Title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
Description:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.




Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.




The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!




Program Details

Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
Location: Onsite at our Stockholm office
Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.




For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values




Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

Apply through our website.
Participate in an introductory interview.
Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
Receive a potential offer.




Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
Glint Solar: Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.
Show more
HTML:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.


Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.


The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

  • 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
  • Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
  • Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
  • Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!


Program Details

  • Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
  • Location: Onsite at our Stockholm office
  • Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
  • Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.


For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

  • Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
  • Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
  • Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
  • Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
  • Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
  • Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
  • Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values


Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

  1. Apply through our website.
  2. Participate in an introductory interview.
  3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
  4. Receive a potential offer.


Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

  • Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
  • Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
  • Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
  • Glint Solar: Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
  • PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.

Om tjänsten

Vi blickar mot en framtid där allt förväntas förändras, särskilt vår interaktion med den digitala världen. På Fortnox utvecklar vi nu den plattform för machine learning som kommer att bilda grund för våra framtida produkter. Med digitala "agenter" i olika former som stöttepelare, möjliggör denna teknik att vi sänker barriären för att driva företag och effektiviserar daglig administration. Arbetet är redan i full gång och vår vision är knivskarp. Du kommer att bli en central figur inom ett av våra etablerade team. För närvarande navigerar teamet genom en mängd spännande utmaningar – alltifrån verktyg och arkitektur till klassificering och generativ AI, allt kretsande kring stora språkmodeller.

Om dig

Nu söker vi dig som är Machine Learning Engineer och har flerårig erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling i produktteam. Du har en bred kompetens från klient till server och arkitektur. Genom antingen formell utbildning eller hands-on erfarenhet har du sedan rört dig mot machine learning. Du har relevant erfarenhet inom Python, ML-ramverk som Pytorch eller TensorFlow samt SQL / RDBMs och meriterande erfarenhet från Huggingface, Kubernetes, mlflow, dvc eller motsvarande verktyg.

Vidare tror vi att du bemästrar hela processen för en modell, från insamling av data till träning och optimering samt utvärdering. Du känner till de senaste teknikerna och verktygen för att skapa och implementera modeller och du är driven för att fortsätta att lära dig nya saker inom området.

För denna roll värdesätter vi djup teknisk kunskap. En del av rekryteringsprocessen involverar därför tekniska intervjuer kretsande kring machine learning, systemarkitektur, och programmeringstester i python.

Vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en central position inom en snabbt växande och välmående organisation. Du får stor frihet att påverka innehållet i din roll, där ditt eget bidrag kommer att ha stor inverkan på företagets resultat. Du kommer få delta i Fortnox strävan att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand.

Hos oss kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta på spännande projekt som utmanar dina färdigheter och utvecklar din karriär. Sök nu och var med och skapa framtiden.

Om Fortnox

Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se www.fortnox.se.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer/Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm. Do you have excellent programming skills and are you interested in working on the frontline of artificial intelligence? Do you like strategic discussions and interacting with people about their real applications? If so, this role is for you!




About Imagimob

Imagimob is a scale-up driving innovation at the forefront of Edge AI and tinyML—and enabling the intelligent products of the future. Based in Stockholm, Sweden, the company has been serving global customers within the automotive, manufacturing, healthcare, and lifestyle industries since 2013. In 2020, Imagimob launched their SaaS solution, Imagimob AI for the swift and easy end-to-end development of Edge AI applications for devices with constrained resources. We are working closely with customers and partners from Europe, North America and Asia-Pacific.




In May 2023, Infineon Technologies AG acquired 100% of the shares in Imagimob. Imagimob belongs to the Connected Secure Systems (CSS) division.




Today we are a team of around 20 employees, divided into three teams: Sales & Marketing, Product Development and Customer Success.




About the position

At Imagimob, you will become a key member of our cross-functional teams, collaborating with innovative AI engineers to develop the next generation of AI-powered products. As a member of our “Customer Success” team, you will work closely with our customers and take an active role in everything from AI Modelling, programming, collecting data to system testing and verification. Since many of our projects are breaking new grounds, your creativity will be challenged on a daily basis. If you love thinking outside the box and get inspired by hard engineering problems, this job will be a great fit. Since we are covering many topics, you will also be able to develop in the areas you find the most interesting.

In the Customer Success team, we focus on time-series, modal and sensor data, including but not limited to; audio, radar data, electrical signals etc. Our work is centred around refining our model development pipeline, ensuring that we build and deploy models efficiently, and applying our learnings to a variety of cases. We emphasise streamlining processes to deliver models quickly and developing the infrastructure to support them.




What you will do

Provide rapid solutions to customers using our products and services.
Tackle a diverse range of customer challenges and issues.
Participate in strategic planning, contribute to shaping our product offerings, and drive initiatives that align with our long-term vision
Develop and deploy efficient AI/ML solutions for edge applications.
Collaborate with the product team to create customer-specific solutions.
Work with the sales team to promote products and projects.
Contribute to the development of infrastructure supporting model deployment and efficiency.




We are looking for someone who has:

Excellent programming skills in Python, and preferably even some knowledge C & C#
Experience in working with machine learning and running models in production
Experience working and upholding high programming standards
Good knowledge of data analysis, statistics, signal processing and its practical applications
University degree or equivalent experience in computer science, electrical engineering, engineering physics or similar
Somebody with ownership and initiative - who is interested in participating in strategy discussions and shaping the future of our products.
Desire for flexibility and handling new tasks or work as it comes in
Experience working independently as well as helping colleagues achieve their goals so that customers are satisfied




Good if you also gave:

Experience working with audio data
Experience in developing on embedded platforms
Experience with a deep learning framework (e.g. Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Caffe)
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning solutions in real-world applications
Experience in programming in C#
Experience in working closely with customers
Interest in educating customers about machine learning




What we offer:

The opportunity to further develop our development platform, responsible for bringing deep learning to the edge
Being a part of an excellent international team with highly motivated individuals striving for a common goal
A chance to be a part of solving real-world problems using ML
Competitive salary, wellness allowance, possibility to attend online courses during working hours and option program
A humble and open-minded company culture
Opportunities to grow with the company and advance your career
Short decision paths, we love getting things done
An office in central Stockholm and the flexibility of working from home




Are you the person we described above? Then click apply!




If you have any questions about the role, please contact zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist for Ventures and New Business
Description:
About Us

Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. Scania’s continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.

Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania’s long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.

We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.

Job Description

As a Venture Data Scientist you will be a key player in new business ventures, responsible for extracting actionable insights from complex data sets to drive strategic decision-making and innovation. By leveraging advanced analytical techniques and machine learning algorithms you will help solve business problems and identify growth opportunities.

Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you will be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practices.

Key Responsibilities

In the role of Venture Data Scientist for a venture your main key task will be:



Data Analysis: Analysing large and diverse data sets to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that inform business strategies and decisions.
Model Development: Building, testing, and deploying predictive models and machine learning algorithms to address specific business challenges.
Data Collection: Designing and implementing data collection processes to ensure the availability of high-quality data for analysis.
Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and marketing professionals, to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.
Reporting and Visualisation: Creating clear and concise reports, dashboards, and visualisations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Staying current with the latest data science techniques, tools, and industry trends to continuously enhance skills and drive innovation.
Data Strategy: Contributing to the development and execution of the venture’s data strategy, including data governance and best practices.



About You

We seek someone with strong experience within engineering and data who can work with the full process within user experience. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are aslo key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.

We also believe that you (requirements):



Bring 5+ years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting.
Have expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent.
Possess strong skills in causal inference and quasi-experimentation.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have a relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Be analytical, curious, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team.
Hold a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Are fluent in English.



What we offer:

We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies.  With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!

Information and application

Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com

We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-10-31.

Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.

Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills


A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
Experience from working in Linux environments
Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Well-versed in matters of IT security
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies, such as GCP
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines


Nice-to-have


Programming skills in Java and Scala
Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)


Learn more about working at SEB at www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-09-30.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, Engineering Manager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
Show more
HTML:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills

  • A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
  • Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
  • Experience from working in Linux environments
  • Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
  • Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
  • Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
  • Well-versed in matters of IT security
  • Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
  • Cloud technologies, such as GCP
  • CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines

Nice-to-have

  • Programming skills in Java and Scala
  • Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
  • Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
  • Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
  • Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)

Learn more about working at SEB at www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-09-30.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, Engineering Manager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

Title: Software Engineer -Python
Description:
About Us

With over 85 million global active users and 2,5 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?

What You Will Do


Be part of a team that is building an internal knowledge graph to unify and improve access to product information
Build tools for AI agents that will enable users to easily update or access information from the graph
Build slack automations that trigger actions, aimed at maintaining data freshness in the graph
Develop tooling that leverages AI to scan and monitor sources of information with the purpose of feeding the graph with further information


Who You Are


Strong proficiency in Python, with experience in developing automation tools and handling API integrations
Familiar with modern Python frameworks and libraries
Extensive experience with RESTful APIs, preferably using FastAPI
Proven ability to design, build and maintain APIs that interact with external systems
Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines


Awesome to Have


Interest and experience with graph data modeling
Experience with graph databases such as Neo4j
Curiosity to continuously test new ways to leverage AI in daily work


Closing

Please include a CV in English.

Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.

Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.
Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.

Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

As a Research Scientist your main responsibility is to contribute to new and improved products developed within the framework of Cepheids development plans. You are expected to be able to individually plan, perform and analyse experiments and thereby contribute to generating information in one or several of the ongoing product development projects. This includes mainly practical work in the laboratory in addition to planning and analysing experiments.

To be successful in this role it requires that you can, with a moderate level of guidance and direction, gain the knowledge needed to plan, perform and analyse experiments. You are also expected to contribute intellectually within your own discipline and be able to provide informal guidance to new team members. We expect you to be organized and paying attention to details when performing experiments. You should be a team player with good communication skills.

In addition to work within the projects you are expected to contribute with your competence to other activities within the department which may include planning, coordination and performing common tasks, suggesting improvements, reporting deviations, and by other means actively contributing to the fulfilment of goals within the project, department and company.

All tasks should be performed with high quality and within timelines.

This position is part of the Assay R&D team and will be in Solna, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:


Evaluate, test, and optimize real time PCR and RT-PCR assay procedures and assay prototypes based on design of experiments and design input requirements.
Deliver experimental plans, perform and analyse experiments and report the deliveries.
Actively contribute to achievement of goals in the project, department and company.
Take part in sophisticated analytical problem-solving to reagent and system integration issues to identify critical performance factors for assay development
Work in a team environment
Analyze data using statistical tools such as Microsoft Excel, Minitab or JMP
Work in a BSL3 environment


Cepheid offers a dynamic and fast-paced role in a company with products that save lives. You will join a team with competent people who have fun together.

The essential requirements of the job include:


Bachelor's degree in relevant scientific discipline (e.g., Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology) with 2+ years of related work experience OR
Master's degree in relevant scientific discipline (e.g., Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology) with 0-2 years of related work experience.
Knowledge of molecular biology methods such as PCR and real-time PCR, experimental design, data analysis and statistical techniques
Ability to individually plan, perform and analyse experiments
Good ability to structure, organize and prioritize lab work and to maintain detailed experimental records


Experience from IVD product development under design control is a great advantage for this position.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:


Experience from IVD product development under design control


Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.

At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what’s next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer II
Description:
We in the Machine Learning product area in the Activation, Retention, Conversion studio are focused on building robust and scalable machine learning solutions that can personalize activation, retention and conversion funnels to improve important business metrics like SUBS and MAU. Through our messaging platform as well as other discovery & conversion surfaces, we communicate with users to connect them with valuable audio content and to help the business grow.

Our vision is to build the machine learning models and infrastructure that offers a fully personalized and ML-optimized experience for listeners throughout their user journey that powers every messaging and conversion campaign at Spotify.

This role sits in a squad called White Mouse that owns the optimization of plan upsell targeting across Spotify. Our key problem areas are: What plan should the user be upsold on discovery surfaces? How should we communicate the user on consideration surfaces? How should we balance upselling plans vs other paid products?

What You'll Do


Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s product by hands-on ML development
Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality
Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in your mission and across Spotify


Who You Are


You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice
You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts
You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages
Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus
You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models
You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation
You have a desire to drive business impact


Where You'll Be


This role will be located in our London or Stockholm office


#JobSite-Sub-MachineLearning

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?




What's in it for you?

You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.

Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.

You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.




What you'd be doing?

You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.

Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.

You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.







About you?

You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI.

You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.

You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.

Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.




A bit about them?

A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.

The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.

With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.







Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to mitch@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.

Title: Junior Java utvecklare till IT-konsultföretag – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se

För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en junior Java utvecklare. Vår kund är ett snabbväxande IT-konsultföretag som utmanar den traditionella konsultbranschen genom att sätta sina anställda i fokus. Företaget grundades år 2014 och har 34 anställda.

I rollen som utvecklare erbjuds du möjligheten att välja mellan ett brett spektrum av projekt i Stockholm utformade efter dina egna preferenser och expertis. Ditt arbete är fokuserat på Java men du har stora möjligheter att arbeta med andra programmeringsspråk, ramverk och teknologier om du har intresse av att göra det.

Du har:


Upp till 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Java
Relevant högskoleutbildning


Meriterande:


JavaScript/TypeScript (React, Node, Vue, Angular)
IOS (Swift) or Android (Kotlin)
React Native
C#/.NET


Som utvecklare hos vår kund har du en stor möjlighet att påverka ditt arbete. Du erbjuds bra arbetsvillkor, pension och friskvårdsbidrag.

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior Java utvecklare till IT-konsultföretag – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.
Show more

  • C#/.NET

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior Java utvecklare till IT-konsultföretag – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

Title: Frontend Software Engineer
Description:
Location / Time zone

Fully remote work. Hybrid options are available for those who live near our offices. Most of your closest peers live in Europe and work regular CET office hours.

You must have the right to work in the country of your application - Devant will not provide visa sponsorship for this employment.




About the role

Devant specialises in creating highly detailed and diverse datasets of lifelike digital humans. Our synthetic digital actors perform actions and exhibit behaviours akin to real humans, with fully configurable characteristics such as age, BMI, and clothing. This flexibility allows customers to control every parameter of the datasets they order.

Our datasets depict these humans in various environments and scenarios, whose configuration options range from simple to highly complex. For instance, while some parameters might remain constant across a dataset (e.g. camera focal length), others might depend on probabilities (e.g. weather conditions selected based on the virtual time of day in a given image). More complex dependencies also exist: a customer might require that 33% of all adult humans in 50% of all images captured by any near-infrared camera in a specific scenario are equipped with glasses, whose optics exhibit challenging (for the camera) properties.

To manage and streamline even more intricate configurations, we are overhauling our products that act as interfaces for anything scenario-related. Our objective is to develop a suite of products that supports iteration on current scenarios and facilitates the rapid creation of new ones.




We are now seeking a Frontend Software Engineer with extensive experience in web technologies to join us at this pivotal stage. Given where we're at, you will play a crucial role in shaping the products we are building.




Responsibilities: What you’ll spend your time on

Build user experiences that encapsulate everything scenario-related (see above)
Simplify the workflow for generating derivative datasets where the original scenario configuration needs adjustments
Integrate, leverage, and refactor existing internal services and APIs to minimise duplication and enhance modularity
Improve the tooling that gives us answers to, and insights on, how our scenarios and content assets are configured/have been used in the past
Collaborate with peers across our engineering, business, and content teams. There are internal products that allow our employees to self-serve questions about the scenarios and the datasets we've produced, but they need to do more than scratch the surface




Qualifications: Past experiences and personal interests we believe are helpful in this role

Extensive real-world experience in UI/UX development with modern web frameworks and technologies
A strong preference for utilising established human interface guidelines
Proven experience working closely with customers, with a deep understanding of pain points in product usage
Experience in visual programming languages - in particular, the node graph architecture
A pragmatic approach to work with a bias towards short, iterative development cycles
Proficiency in debugging and visualising the inner workings of complex products
A good understanding of spatial data and 3D structures, as well as statistics
A degree in Computer Science (BSc or higher)
Experience in Laravel / Vue.js / MySQL / AWS (These are used by some of the components in our current frontend stack, but do note that we evaluate alternatives regularly)




What does success look like?

We've significantly reduced the time from receiving an order of a new scenario to having received customer approval of the corresponding dataset(s)
We've streamlined the configuration of scenarios so that we can collaborate in realtime on these inside the products we're building, together with our customers




Compensation and benefits

Competitive salary and employment benefits
Flexibility in work arrangements – we prioritise results over hours clocked




About Devant

Devant was founded in 2021 in Sweden and provides high-quality synthetic data to support the training, validation and testing of Machine Learning networks. Offering unparalleled data customization, we deliver lifelike 3D simulations that enable Machine Learning developers to generate any real-life scenario. This empowers businesses to boost the performance of their computer vision applications, while also reducing bias normally associated with human-centric data.




Our team includes experts from the VFX, Computer Graphics, and Machine Learning industries.

Devant’s aim, in collaboration with existing and future partners, is to continue to lead the synthetic data market and in turn, help revolutionise the speed of technological innovation across a variety of industries and enable safe and trustworthy human-machine interaction.

Show more

Title: Chef Data Science
Description:
Drivs du av att omsätta data till insikter i affären? Har du förmågan att tänka stort, entusiasmera och realisera dina idéer? Då kan detta vara jobbet för dig!

Om jobbet

Aktuarie & Analys har en offensiv förändringsagenda med målet att förflytta Länsförsäkrings-gruppens analytiska förmåga. Vi stärker oss inom data science med målsättningen att utveckla och operationalisera ML-modeller i våra system och processer. Det kan till exempel handla om fraud, next best offer och churn. Vi utforskar också möjligheterna med generativt AI som språkmodeller. Ansvarsområden Data Science-gruppen har är bland annat:


Utveckla, testa och produktionssätta ML-modeller.
Utveckla och utforska möjligheter med generativt AI.
Förvalta/vidareutveckla modeller och övervaka prestanda.
Ställa krav på data och på den tekniska implementationen i tågen för att kunna genomföra nödvändig analys och samla in relevant data.
Föda in insikter till marknadskommunikation, pris, reserv, produkt och skador.


Du rapporterar till chef Aktuarie & Analys, ingår i avdelningens ledningsgrupp och har stora kontaktytor inom avdelningen samt mot övrig verksamhet.

Vem är du?

Du har dokumenterade ledarerfarenheter och brinner för att utveckla statistiska modeller lika mycket som att utveckla människor och verksamhet. Då vi är en specialistverksamhet handlar jobbet till stor del att förklara och sälja in gruppens arbete till personer som inte besitter lika djup kompetens som dig inom området. Därför är det extra viktigt att vara pedagogisk och kommunikativ i denna roll.

Som person är du prestigelös med förmåga att inspirera och skapa engagemang hos dina medarbetare genom tydliga målbilder. Du har erfarenheter av att leda motsvarande utveckling från idé till genomförande i komplexa organisationer med många kontaktytor. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av personalansvar i grupp med analytiska medarbetare och har du även erfarenhet från lean-agilt arbete så är det meriterande.

Vidare ser vi även att du:


Är intresserad av affären och har ett genuint intresse av att skapa värde i ditt arbete.
Är strategisk och analytisk och får saker att hända med ett hands-on perspektiv.
Har relevant akademisk utbildning med erfarenhet av att utveckla AI-modeller.


Om oss

Affärsenhet SAK inom Länsförsäkringar AB ansvarar för service och utveckling av länsförsäkringsgruppens sakförsäkringsaffär. Aktuarie & Analys är en utpräglad specialistavdelning om knappt 100 medarbetare främst bestående av aktuarier och analytiker, som jobbar på uppdrag av våra 26 sakförsäkringsbolag i Länsförsäkrings-gruppen. Data Science gruppen består av 13 medarbetare.

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-18

Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocessen kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt.

Hos oss är du med och påverkar ditt eget arbete – hela kulturen bygger på en hög grad av självledarskap, eget lärande och utveckling. Tycker du om att leda dig själv och utveckla din fulla potential kommer du att trivas hos oss. Vi är en arbetsgivare som vill bidra till ett hållbart arbetsliv genom att erbjuda sjukvårdsförsäkring, friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension i anställningen. Bra anställningsvillkor och ett förmånligt försäkringsskydd till dig och familjen är andra exempel. Vi utvecklar ett flexibelt arbetssätt, med en god företagskultur och tydliga värderingar skapar vi en attraktiv arbetsplats för alla att trivas i. Välkommen med din ansökan!
Show more

Title: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Team!
Description:
Telenor Connexion is a leading, Scandinavian provider of IoT (Internet of Things) services with over 20 years of experience working with enterprises around the world.




We are a global leader in connecting things and manage more than 20 million connections across the world for multinational customers such as Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct and Husqvarna. We provide easy and reliable access to every market in the world and enable industry leading players to connect their products and services on a global scale across every vertical.




Telenor Connexion is a specialized IoT company within the Telenor Group and together we rank among the top 3 IoT operators in Europe and among the top 10 in the world. With headquarters and tech center located in the Nordics, we have sales representation in the UK, US, Germany, Italy, South Africa, South Korea, China, Taiwan and Japan.




The Position and the Team




We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with excellent capabilities in advanced and modern data processing of large volumes and velocity to join our team.




In this position, you and the team are responsible for:




Architecting and developing our data platform, which includes Fetching, processing, and preparing data – both batch and real-time data.
Developing Analytics reports and tools.
Develop and manage ML-models.
Piloting and driving AI-use cases into production.
The team also has a DevOps responsibility which in our case means that “what we build we also operate, and we take care of it”.




The Data Team interacts and serves business value to almost every part of the organization. The team is also responsible for delivering direct customer value, either by supporting customer facing colleagues or via customer facing Data products. The team is highly advanced and has run production-workloads using Big Data technologies for more than 8 years and constantly innovates, improves, and iterates the solution. The platform processes 400 000 000 000 real-time events per year and is currently running several thousands of online Machine Learning models (in production).




This is a great opportunity to become part of a mature and efficient data team, with a massive exposure to our global business. We are not afraid of taking things to production and have solid confidence that it will work and target the desired business value. And if not, the team pivots and changes its approach accordingly. We value a great team attitude, and it is important that the new team-member matches or complements our team culture and dynamics.




This role reports to our Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) and is located in Stockholm, Karlskrona or Gothenburg.







Required Experience and Skills

To be successful in this position, you should have extensive experience and skills in advance use cases of:




PySpark
Pandas
Athena/Trino
Apache Iceberg
AWS Glue
AWS StepFunctions
Apache Flink
CI/CD design patterns.
Python
Java
Data-oriented test-cases
Reference Data management
Distributed workloads including partitioning strategies.
Scalable data processing patterns.




Other requirements

MSc in Software/Data Engineering or similar
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and preferably Swedish.
Residence and work permit in Sweden




We put strong emphasis on the experience of processing high and growing volume data usecases. For example, you should have been part of a team that faced scaling issues of your data processing task at least couple of times during your career. If your team solved it by moving to a larger instance, then we won’t be impressed. If throughput scaled linearly with your cluster scale-out, then you might be a good candidate. On the other hand, if you can give examples where your team’s redesigned solutions resulted in a lowering of cost per billion records processed – then you are likely an ideal candidate!




Candidates should also be knowledgeable in secure design and access patterns, and preferably hold AWS Certificate or at least Associate level in any of the Data Engineer, Solution Architect or Developer domains.




As a person

We are looking for a committed and self-driven person with a positive and optimistic attitude. You are not afraid to take large responsibility. You are business-oriented and good with people. You love to share technical know-how and good practice. The team shares a test-driven approach and a common interest to work across several environments and programming languages, utilizing the powers of the cloud and we hope that this resonates with you too.




Our Offer




Telenor Connexion offers you a chance to be a part of one of the most interesting areas within the tech industry where the work we do has a huge impact on almost all areas in society. We are a fast-growing international company with great possibilities for your career ahead. Telenor Connexion is a flat and people-oriented organization with attractive job benefits where you have the opportunity to influence and build your role and make a real difference in building our brand.




We are a team consisting of a diverse group of talented innovators, including platform developers, service engineers, data scientists and marketers. What unites us all is a dedication to providing our customers solutions and services that have a positive effect on businesses and communities.




You will also have:

Attractive and competitive bonus scheme
Additional days off during the year
Flexible and hybrid work policy
Nice offices for collaborative work
Training and development focused company
Friendly work environment that recognizes each employee’s potential and value
Talented and engaged colleagues all around the world.







Application

Ensure that your submitted CV includes relevant project references, your role, contribution to the delivery, and data volume in place. Please motivate in your application letter why you think you have the relevant advanced experience (or why you would be able to acquire it in a short period of time). We expect that every applicant is on a constant learning and development journey, and hence will be able to obtain potential lacking competences needed for the role during the employment. If this is the case, please be transparent in your application letter, so that expectations are reasonable.




Finally, we would love to get to know you in your personal letter, mentioning principles that is close to your heart, what you value in a work environment, what you like to talk about by the coffee machine, what you do off-work to re-charge or explore your other non-data related passions of life.







Placement: Stockholm or Karlskrona




Application and contact: Please apply through our recruitment system Workday.




If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact Ander Bresell (Head of Data Engineering, anders.bresell@telenorconnexion.com




Deadline: The closing date for applications is September 30th the latest. If you are interested, please apply as soon as possible as we will interview continuously. The position might be filled before the last application day.

Title: Data Scientist - Commercial
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about leveraging data to drive commercial success in the gaming industry. In this role, you’ll focus on using analytics to identify growth opportunities, optimise game monetization strategies, and support business development initiatives. You’ll partner with game designers, product managers, and business stakeholders to unlock data-driven insights that fuel our business growth and maximise player engagement.

Example Of Responsibilities


Analyse game performance metrics and player data to identify business opportunities.
Provide insights and recommendations to optimise in-game economies, pricing models, and player engagement initiatives.
Collaborate with business development and product teams to develop data-driven monetization strategies.
Build dashboards and reports to track business performance and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.



We would love if you have


Strong background in SQL.
Experience in working with ETLs and data pipelines.
Proficiency in Python for data modelling and analysis over large datasets.
Experience in building dashboards and using tools such as Google Colab.
Ability to communicate insights and strategies to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience or interest in games.
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."
Show more
HTML:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about leveraging data to drive commercial success in the gaming industry. In this role, you’ll focus on using analytics to identify growth opportunities, optimise game monetization strategies, and support business development initiatives. You’ll partner with game designers, product managers, and business stakeholders to unlock data-driven insights that fuel our business growth and maximise player engagement.

Example Of Responsibilities

  • Analyse game performance metrics and player data to identify business opportunities.
  • Provide insights and recommendations to optimise in-game economies, pricing models, and player engagement initiatives.
  • Collaborate with business development and product teams to develop data-driven monetization strategies.
  • Build dashboards and reports to track business performance and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.


We would love if you have

  • Strong background in SQL.
  • Experience in working with ETLs and data pipelines.
  • Proficiency in Python for data modelling and analysis over large datasets.
  • Experience in building dashboards and using tools such as Google Colab.
  • Ability to communicate insights and strategies to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience or interest in games.
  • Professional English communication skills.


At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.

Om tjänsten

Vi blickar mot en framtid där allt förväntas förändras, särskilt vår interaktion med den digitala världen. På Fortnox utvecklar vi nu den plattform för machine learning som kommer att bilda grund för våra framtida produkter. Med digitala "agenter" i olika former som stöttepelare, möjliggör denna teknik att vi sänker barriären för att driva företag och effektiviserar daglig administration. Arbetet är redan i full gång och vår vision är knivskarp. Du kommer att bli en central figur inom ett av våra etablerade team. För närvarande navigerar teamet genom en mängd spännande utmaningar – alltifrån verktyg och arkitektur till klassificering och generativ AI, allt kretsande kring stora språkmodeller.

Om dig

Nu söker vi dig som är Machine Learning Engineer och har flerårig erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling i produktteam. Du har en bred kompetens från klient till server och arkitektur. Genom antingen formell utbildning eller hands-on erfarenhet har du sedan rört dig mot machine learning. Du har relevant erfarenhet inom Python, ML-ramverk som Pytorch eller TensorFlow samt SQL / RDBMs och meriterande erfarenhet från Huggingface, Kubernetes, mlflow, dvc eller motsvarande verktyg.

Vidare tror vi att du bemästrar hela processen för en modell, från insamling av data till träning och optimering samt utvärdering. Du känner till de senaste teknikerna och verktygen för att skapa och implementera modeller och du är driven för att fortsätta att lära dig nya saker inom området.

För denna roll värdesätter vi djup teknisk kunskap. En del av rekryteringsprocessen involverar därför tekniska intervjuer kretsande kring machine learning, systemarkitektur, och programmeringstester i python.

Vi erbjuder

Vi erbjuder en central position inom en snabbt växande och välmående organisation. Du får stor frihet att påverka innehållet i din roll, där ditt eget bidrag kommer att ha stor inverkan på företagets resultat. Du kommer få delta i Fortnox strävan att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand.

Hos oss kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta på spännande projekt som utmanar dina färdigheter och utvecklar din karriär. Sök nu och var med och skapa framtiden.

Om Fortnox

Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se www.fortnox.se.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills


A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
Experience from working in Linux environments
Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Well-versed in matters of IT security
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies, such as GCP
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines


Nice-to-have


Programming skills in Java and Scala
Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)


Learn more about working at SEB at www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-09-30.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, Engineering Manager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

Title: Software Engineer -Python
Description:
About Us

With over 85 million global active users and 2,5 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?

What You Will Do


Be part of a team that is building an internal knowledge graph to unify and improve access to product information
Build tools for AI agents that will enable users to easily update or access information from the graph
Build slack automations that trigger actions, aimed at maintaining data freshness in the graph
Develop tooling that leverages AI to scan and monitor sources of information with the purpose of feeding the graph with further information


Who You Are


Strong proficiency in Python, with experience in developing automation tools and handling API integrations
Familiar with modern Python frameworks and libraries
Extensive experience with RESTful APIs, preferably using FastAPI
Proven ability to design, build and maintain APIs that interact with external systems
Excellent collaboration skills and the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines


Awesome to Have


Interest and experience with graph data modeling
Experience with graph databases such as Neo4j
Curiosity to continuously test new ways to leverage AI in daily work


Closing

Please include a CV in English.

Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.

Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.

Title: Data Scientist for Ventures and New Business
Description:
About Us

Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. Scania’s continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.

Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania’s long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.

We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.

Job Description

As a Venture Data Scientist you will be a key player in new business ventures, responsible for extracting actionable insights from complex data sets to drive strategic decision-making and innovation. By leveraging advanced analytical techniques and machine learning algorithms you will help solve business problems and identify growth opportunities.

Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you will be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practices.

Key Responsibilities

In the role of Venture Data Scientist for a venture your main key task will be:



Data Analysis: Analysing large and diverse data sets to uncover patterns, trends, and insights that inform business strategies and decisions.
Model Development: Building, testing, and deploying predictive models and machine learning algorithms to address specific business challenges.
Data Collection: Designing and implementing data collection processes to ensure the availability of high-quality data for analysis.
Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and marketing professionals, to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.
Reporting and Visualisation: Creating clear and concise reports, dashboards, and visualisations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement: Staying current with the latest data science techniques, tools, and industry trends to continuously enhance skills and drive innovation.
Data Strategy: Contributing to the development and execution of the venture’s data strategy, including data governance and best practices.



About You

We seek someone with strong experience within engineering and data who can work with the full process within user experience. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are aslo key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.

We also believe that you (requirements):



Bring 5+ years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting.
Have expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, Matlab, R, or equivalent.
Possess strong skills in causal inference and quasi-experimentation.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have a relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
Be analytical, curious, and a self-starter who is motivated to achieve results and collaborate with colleagues both inside and outside of the team.
Hold a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Are fluent in English.



What we offer:

We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies.  With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!

Information and application

Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com

We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-10-31.

Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.

Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com
