Title: Machine Learning Engineer II
Description:
We in the Machine Learning product area in the Activation, Retention, Conversion studio are focused on building robust and scalable machine learning solutions that can personalize activation, retention and conversion funnels to improve important business metrics like SUBS and MAU. Through our messaging platform as well as other discovery & conversion surfaces, we communicate with users to connect them with valuable audio content and to help the business grow.

Our vision is to build the machine learning models and infrastructure that offers a fully personalized and ML-optimized experience for listeners throughout their user journey that powers every messaging and conversion campaign at Spotify.

This role sits in a squad called White Mouse that owns the optimization of plan upsell targeting across Spotify. Our key problem areas are: What plan should the user be upsold on discovery surfaces? How should we communicate the user on consideration surfaces? How should we balance upselling plans vs other paid products?

What You'll Do


Contribute to designing, building, evaluating, shipping, and refining Spotify’s product by hands-on ML development
Collaborate with a multi-functional agile team spanning user research, design, data science, product management, and engineering to build new product features that advance our mission to connect artists and fans in personalized and relevant ways
Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our hundreds of millions of active users
Help drive optimisation, testing, and tooling to improve quality
Be part of an active group of machine learning practitioners in your mission and across Spotify


Who You Are


You have a strong background in machine learning, theory, and practice
You are comfortable explaining the intuition and assumptions behind ML concepts
You have hands-on experience implementing and maintaining production ML systems in Python, Scala, or similar languages
Experience with TensorFlow is also a plus
You are experienced with building data pipelines, and you are self-sufficient in getting the data you need to build and evaluate your models
You preferably have experience with cloud platforms like GCP or AWS
You care about agile software processes, data development, reliability, and focused experimentation
You have a desire to drive business impact


Where You'll Be


This role will be located in our London or Stockholm office


#JobSite-Sub-MachineLearning

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.

Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

As a Research Scientist your main responsibility is to contribute to new and improved products developed within the framework of Cepheids development plans. You are expected to be able to individually plan, perform and analyse experiments and thereby contribute to generating information in one or several of the ongoing product development projects. This includes mainly practical work in the laboratory in addition to planning and analysing experiments.

To be successful in this role it requires that you can, with a moderate level of guidance and direction, gain the knowledge needed to plan, perform and analyse experiments. You are also expected to contribute intellectually within your own discipline and be able to provide informal guidance to new team members. We expect you to be organized and paying attention to details when performing experiments. You should be a team player with good communication skills.

In addition to work within the projects you are expected to contribute with your competence to other activities within the department which may include planning, coordination and performing common tasks, suggesting improvements, reporting deviations, and by other means actively contributing to the fulfilment of goals within the project, department and company.

All tasks should be performed with high quality and within timelines.

This position is part of the Assay R&D team and will be in Solna, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:


Evaluate, test, and optimize real time PCR and RT-PCR assay procedures and assay prototypes based on design of experiments and design input requirements.
Deliver experimental plans, perform and analyse experiments and report the deliveries.
Actively contribute to achievement of goals in the project, department and company.
Take part in sophisticated analytical problem-solving to reagent and system integration issues to identify critical performance factors for assay development
Work in a team environment
Analyze data using statistical tools such as Microsoft Excel, Minitab or JMP
Work in a BSL3 environment


Cepheid offers a dynamic and fast-paced role in a company with products that save lives. You will join a team with competent people who have fun together.

The essential requirements of the job include:


Bachelor's degree in relevant scientific discipline (e.g., Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology) with 2+ years of related work experience OR
Master's degree in relevant scientific discipline (e.g., Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology) with 0-2 years of related work experience.
Knowledge of molecular biology methods such as PCR and real-time PCR, experimental design, data analysis and statistical techniques
Ability to individually plan, perform and analyse experiments
Good ability to structure, organize and prioritize lab work and to maintain detailed experimental records


Experience from IVD product development under design control is a great advantage for this position.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:


Experience from IVD product development under design control


Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.

At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what’s next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar i en innovativ och snabbväxande miljö? Agria söker en driven Data Scientist med fokus på AI, NLP och intelligenta system. Hos oss får du möjligheten att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av skräddarsydda AI-lösningar som gör skillnad.

Om jobbet

Agria är marknadsledande inom djurförsäkringar i Norden och siktar på att bli störst i Europa. Vår framgång bygger på innovation, snabbhet och kundfokus. För att nå våra mål bygger vi en affärsagil organisation som kombinerar IT och affärsverksamhet för snabbare och mer innovativa lösningar. I denna position kommer du att arbeta med avancerade AI-lösningar, där särskilt fokus ligger på naturlig språkbehandling (NLP) och utveckling av intelligenta system, chatbotar och språkmodeller. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och implementera skräddarsydda AI-lösningar med hjälp av Python och moderna verktyg och tekniker, främst inom Azure. Rollen innebär även arbete med bildigenkänning och samarbete med övrig utveckling för att säkerställa att lösningarna hänger ihop i en helhet både frontend och backend.

Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:


Utveckla och implementera avancerade AI-lösningar med fokus på NLP och intelligenta system.
Bygga och optimera chatbotar och språkmodeller.
Använda Python och dess ekosystem för att skapa skräddarsydda lösningar.
Arbeta med bildigenkänning och relaterade AI-tekniker.
Samarbeta med andra utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa en integrerad lösning mellan frontend och backend.
Använda Microsoft Azure och Azure DevOps för att automatisera och optimera CI/CD pipelines.
Delta i projekt som kombinerar IT och affärsverksamhet för att leverera innovativa lösningar med hög kvalitet.


Vem är du?

Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik för denna tjänst:


God tidigare erfarenhet som Data Scientist eller snarlikt.
Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och dess ekosystem.
Allmän erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
Erfarenhet inom Naturlig språkbehandling (NLP) och AI-utveckling.
Erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera chatbotar och språkmodeller.
Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure.
Kunskaper inom Azure DevOps, med fokus på automatisering och CI/CD pipelines.
Kunskaper inom bildigenkänning och relaterade AI-tekniker.


Meriterande är även om du har:


Erfarenhet av att arbeta med skadehantering inom försäkringsbranschen.
Erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling.


Som person är du självgående och trivs med att arbeta i mindre team där stort ansvar och drivkraft för att leda egna projekt framåt är avgörande. Nyfikenhet och analytisk förmåga är viktiga egenskaper, och du finner glädje i att lösa svåra problem. Förmågan att snabbt sätta dig in i nya teknologier och metoder gör att du ständigt utvecklas och bidrar till teamets framgång. Stark kommunikativ förmåga är ett måste, särskilt när det gäller att förklara komplexa tekniska koncept på ett lättförståeligt sätt för både kollegor och kunder. Att ligga i framkant inom ditt område och att dela med dig av insikter och kunskaper till resten av teamet är något som driver dig.

Om oss

Välkommen till Agria Djurförsäkring – en plats där vi skapar trygghet för djur och människor. Allt vi gör, gör vi för djuren. Det genomsyrar hela vår medarbetarkultur och märks i alla beslut vi fattar. Vi tror på att människor med en genuin passion för djur är nyckeln till att förmedla vårt erbjudande och att upprätthålla våra mål, mission och löften.

Vi vill bidra till en kreativ och lärande miljö där du som vill utveckla dig själv och verksamheten ska kunna göra det. En miljö där vi som arbetsgivare ger dig rätt stöd och ledarskap. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsplats att trivas i och vi välkomnar alla, oavsett bakgrund.

Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike, Irland och Nederländerna. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vet Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning. Var med oss på resan att skapa Europas största och mest valbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.

Hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas i en innovativ och snabbväxande miljö, där du får arbeta med banbrytande teknik och vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar.

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-24
Show more

Title: Junior Java utvecklare till IT-konsultföretag – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se

För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en junior Java utvecklare. Vår kund är ett snabbväxande IT-konsultföretag som utmanar den traditionella konsultbranschen genom att sätta sina anställda i fokus. Företaget grundades år 2014 och har 34 anställda.

I rollen som utvecklare erbjuds du möjligheten att välja mellan ett brett spektrum av projekt i Stockholm utformade efter dina egna preferenser och expertis. Ditt arbete är fokuserat på Java men du har stora möjligheter att arbeta med andra programmeringsspråk, ramverk och teknologier om du har intresse av att göra det.

Du har:


Upp till 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Java
Relevant högskoleutbildning


Meriterande:


JavaScript/TypeScript (React, Node, Vue, Angular)
IOS (Swift) or Android (Kotlin)
React Native
C#/.NET


Som utvecklare hos vår kund har du en stor möjlighet att påverka ditt arbete. Du erbjuds bra arbetsvillkor, pension och friskvårdsbidrag.

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior Java utvecklare till IT-konsultföretag – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

Title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Python/Kotlin and React), Privacy
Description:
Job Description

In our data-driven world, safeguarding user privacy is paramount. At Wolt, we are committed to ensuring full compliance with laws, regulations, and industry standards across all our markets while supporting other teams in managing the processes in an efficient and joyful fashion. We're now looking for a Senior Full-stack (back-end and Web) engineer to join a brand new Privacy & Compliance team to be the one of the first members of the team. This is a great opportunity for an experienced engineer who is passionate about user rights, data protection, and building tools to enable others to join us on this critical mission.

The Privacy & Compliance team is an end-to-end team with a Product Lead, an Engineering Team Lead and engineers covering back-end and client domains.

The team will be responsible for:


Developing scalable and robust solutions that integrate seamlessly with company-wide systems to ensure strict adherence to information security policies and procedures for all Wolt countries.
Monitoring and evaluating the adoption of new technologies and data storage methods to maintain privacy compliance.
Leading the charge in defining and implementing best practices for data anonymization, deletion, and protection, and building solutions that help other teams incorporate the practices.


As a member of the team, you'll have the unique opportunity to:


Play a pivotal role in shaping the team's direction and culture from the ground up.
Explore and integrate diverse data flows and storage architectures to create a secure and compliant data ecosystem.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams across the organization to understand their needs and implement effective privacy solutions.
Take ownership of the tools and frameworks that enable data anonymization, deletion, and protection.


Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - don't worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.

Our humble expectations

We're seeking a highly skilled and motivated engineer who is passionate about safeguarding user data and ensuring strict compliance with privacy regulations. Understanding of data pipelines, storage systems, and data governance is highly desirable. We’d love to see interest and knowledge of relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and industry best practices.

To excel as a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you'll need several years of experience in back-end development, coupled with an understanding of front-end technologies. We leverage Kotlin, Python, and TypeScript (with React) for our development stack. Our infrastructure relies on MongoDB and PostgreSQL for databases, Git for version control, and Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.

But there's more! We're looking for someone who takes ownership beyond the obvious, is motivated to learn new things and share knowledge and loves collaborating with different teams across the organization.

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.


Show more
HTML:
Job Description

In our data-driven world, safeguarding user privacy is paramount. At Wolt, we are committed to ensuring full compliance with laws, regulations, and industry standards across all our markets while supporting other teams in managing the processes in an efficient and joyful fashion. We're now looking for a Senior Full-stack (back-end and Web) engineer to join a brand new Privacy & Compliance team to be the one of the first members of the team. This is a great opportunity for an experienced engineer who is passionate about user rights, data protection, and building tools to enable others to join us on this critical mission.

The Privacy & Compliance team is an end-to-end team with a Product Lead, an Engineering Team Lead and engineers covering back-end and client domains.

The team will be responsible for:

  • Developing scalable and robust solutions that integrate seamlessly with company-wide systems to ensure strict adherence to information security policies and procedures for all Wolt countries.
  • Monitoring and evaluating the adoption of new technologies and data storage methods to maintain privacy compliance.
  • Leading the charge in defining and implementing best practices for data anonymization, deletion, and protection, and building solutions that help other teams incorporate the practices.

As a member of the team, you'll have the unique opportunity to:

  • Play a pivotal role in shaping the team's direction and culture from the ground up.
  • Explore and integrate diverse data flows and storage architectures to create a secure and compliant data ecosystem.
  • Collaborate closely with engineering teams across the organization to understand their needs and implement effective privacy solutions.
  • Take ownership of the tools and frameworks that enable data anonymization, deletion, and protection.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small business to the world’s most recognizable brands - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.

We’re now looking for an experienced and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to further strengthen the team.

In this position, you will be working on applying machine learning to improve the search and discovery capabilities in our product and drive value for our users. We have already built a number of ML powered applications that are highly appreciated by our users, with examples including intelligent search features such as semantic, and audio-similarity-based search, recommender systems, tagging and previews of music.

You will take a leading role in a team that is solving problems at the core of Epidemic’s products. We are at the beginning of our journey to deliver the very best search experiences for our users. We are agile, user focused and passionate about building a high quality product and, most importantly, we make sure to learn from each other and have a lot of fun on the way!

How You Will Make An Impact

Building features at the very core of how our users get value from Epidemic.
From idea to production, your team owns projects and maintains the systems in production.
Build prototypes, conduct experiments, and operationalize solutions at scale.
Continue to foster a curious and explorative culture in a collaborative environment.
Initiate and drive projects to success together with your team.
Improve technical processes and tooling.
Coach and mentor team members and staff from other teams.  


Who You Are


Computer Science and Machine Learning with results in industry or academia.
Working as a Machine Learning Engineer in somewhat advanced stages.
Architecting, developing, deploying and monitoring software systems, preferably in Python.



Furthermore, it would be music to our ears if you have experience with:


Building search products.
Adapting/Fine-tuning foundation models to downstream applications.
Applying methods from Music Information Retrieval (MIR), especially using modern architectures.



Equal Opportunity Employer

We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

Application

Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

Epidemic Sound, the market leading platform for restriction-free music, is headquartered in Stockholm, heard around the globe and on a mission to soundtrack the world.The company has democratized access to music for storytellers. Its innovative digital rights model paves the way for creators - everyone from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s largest brands - to use restriction-free music to take their content to the next level, whilst simultaneously supporting the musicians it works with both financially and creatively.The company was co-founded in 2009, operates across the globe, and has offices in five major cities: Stockholm, New York, Los Angeles, Seoul and Amsterdam. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital, Alecta. AMF, and TIN Fonder and its Chairperson is Andrew Fisher, former CEO and Chairman of Shazam.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Go-to-Market (GTM) Applied AI team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

From reviews to user behaviors to internal systems, at Trustpilot, we truly have big data. Every month, more than half a million new reviews are posted on Trustpilot for thousands of businesses. We have now reached 267 million reviews - and that is growing! - from consumers around the world. Our Data Scientists in the GTM Applied AI team leverage this data to build AI/ML models that improve our go-to-market (GTM) efficiency and enhance our pricing and revenue management strategy.

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our GTM Applied AI team to develop, deploy, and maintain our GTM and Pricing models. You will collaborate closely with our pricing and monetization squad and team of software developers, data analytics and ML engineers to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative AI/ML models at scale. You will be part of a unique journey where data, AI, and ML are at the heart of our product and company strategy. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate broadly across the business, including with our Commercial, Digital Sales, and Applied AI teams, in both B2B and B2C contexts.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying AI/ML models to enhance commercial practices. You have a solid technical background, with hands-on ability in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. You must have an adaptable commercial mindset and knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. The ability to develop AI/ML solutions, engage stakeholders, and clearly articulate the impact of your work is necessary for this role. Experience putting solutions into production within an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you also have experience using AI and ML to solve pricing and revenue management problems.

What You’ll Be Doing


You will be involved in delivering some of our most exciting Data Science projects aimed at improving our GTM efficiency and pricing practices: from prediction to ranking, segmentation to NLP, and recommendation systems to content generation.
This is a great opportunity to make a real business impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
You will deliver the Data Science component of key strategic initiatives including owning, maintaining, and deploying production-ready ML/AI models, and analysing data to establish the scope and impact of your work.
You will identify new pricing and monetization opportunities based on data, interpreting model outcomes, and share insights to drive the direction of our business goals.
You will engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders & will translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace.


Who You Are


Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. Attribution, Segmentation, Churn, Upgrade, Upsell, and Pricing & Packaging.
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS will also be fine).
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting.
You have experience of working with large datasets. Knowledge of the data generated by websites or in the eCommerce sector, behavioral analytics, and experience working with data from commercial systems (e.g. Salesforce) is advantageous.
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience of cloud-based ML model deployments is beneficial.
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
Proven technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities

  • Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
  • Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
  • Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
  • Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
  • Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
  • Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
  • At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
  • 3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
  • 4+ years of experience working with Python programming
  • Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
  • Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Student Data Scientist (NLP)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you excited about designing and developing Machine Learning models? Do you have an interest in understanding business problems and find AI solutions to them? Do you have what it takes to increase your power level beyond that of a Notebook Ninja? If so, we want you to join our team as a Student Data Scientist in Commercial Data Science.

We develop a wide range of models that identify customer needs and how we can aid them using financial services (our so-called Next Best Action engine). Using data from customer interaction (messages, chats and calls) we develop NLP solutions that help provide automatic replies and digital routing to create a better customer experience and lower costs from manual processes.

In this role, an explorative mindset is crucial as you will be tasked with uncovering new insights and opportunities from complex data sets. Furthermore, we have ongoing Generative AI (GenAI) projects and PoCs utilising LLMs and vector stores for Retrieval Augmented Generation Tasks for several purposes across the bank. Danske Bank is currently building a full-scale GenAI unit.

Skills in data visualization will be highly valued, as you will be required to present data in a clear, concise manner to various stakeholders, aiding in the understanding and decision-making process.

Therefore you will be working towards developing and exposing AI and ML software to automate predictive models for recommendation, customer self-service (auto-reply) and GenAI.

Your Challenges

In close collaboration with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and ML Engineers you will be responsible for ensuring that business problems are converted to models and solutions that you and the team can build and deploy. You will engage with team members and business owners to understand end-user needs.

As part of our venture into Generative AI, you will be part of scoping and testing practical use cases to understand the potential for the bank. This will happen in close collaboration with peers in other teams across the organization.

As a Student Data Scientist you will:


Build and monitor both online and batch models, delivering the model output as data or exposed as API endpoints.
Utilize off-the-shelf models from e.g. HuggingFace for ML tasks.
Be a role model to other members of the team and help educate Data Scientists, ML Engineers and Data Engineers in the Data Science discipline to ensure that we leverage all its capabilities.
Work in an agile framework, prioritizing your backlog to continuously deliver results.
Cultivate good relationships with data scientists and business experts across the organisation, making their problems yours and providing necessary solutions through products and services.
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks.
Continuously research and analyse the MLOps market, user needs and the product roadmap. Identify potentials for product expansion or pivoting as well as collaborations with external partners, vendors, and open source.


A great match

We imagine that you are in your last year of your Bachelor or in the beginning of your Master education in Computer Science, Data Science or other relevant STEM educations, as well as experience in a similar role. We also imagine that you possess great problem-solving skills, paired with a desire to learn and grow, as the data science landscape changes.

About You

Do you recognise yourself in some of these technologies?


Fine-tuning and/or tinkering with pretrained transformer models (e.g. from Huggingface)
Knowledge about Retrieval Augmented Generation
Familiar with Generative AI technologies including use of GenAI model APIs (e.g. GPT-4, Llama3), embedding models, vector databases, langchain, etc.
Languages/Tools:
Python
Spark/PySpark
Airflow
SQL
Public Cloud providers (preferably AWS)
Terraform
MLFlow
Containerisation (ex. Kubernetes, Docker, Openshift)
Git/Azure DevOps
Self-driven with an ability to work individually and with others in the team and organisation
Outcome-oriented with a focus on delivering
Curious about product development, technology trends with a thirst for knowledge and self-improvement

About The Department

We are a diverse team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and ML Engineers with colleagues in both Scandinavia, India and Lithuania. We have a very research-oriented culture and aim at staying up to date through various research projects with university partnerships across the greater Copenhagen area.

As part of the Commercial Data Science Center of Excellence you will be working in our office in Copenhagen and sit in central part of Danske Banks commercial organisation. We support all 4 Nordic countries (Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Finland) with bleeding edge Machine Learning solutions.

We work closely with the development organization to deliver and integrate Machine Learning solutions in our product offering such as the Mobile Bank, eBank, website and frontline advisors.

We aim at creating a good social atmosphere by arranging events such as hackathons, board game nights, team days etc.

Is this the job for you?

The position is typically 15-20 hours per week. We value a mutually flexible approach to working time - both during our busy periods and during your exam periods. We have a working from home setup where most colleagues work from home a few days a week.

If this sounds great to you, then do not hesitate to apply or reach out! We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and hire when we find the right candidates.

Please feel free to contact if you have any questions:


Head of Advanced Commercial Analytics, Rasmus Brink, via email rbri@danskebank.dk or LinkedIn .
NLP Lead Data Scientist, Ledian Selimaj, via email leds@danskebank.dk or LinkedIn .


About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
Show more

Title: Scientific expert in Data Science and Computational Science
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data science, computational science, and AI? Would you like to be a part of our cutting-edge programmes within these areas, and pave the way for future research breakthroughs? Then join our Nat-Tech department at the Novo Nordisk Foundation which is responsible for the Foundation's activities within the natural and technical sciences.

We are looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic colleague with a strong scientific background and knowledge about the national and international frontline of data science, computational science, AI, and potentially also the interface to quantum.

You will join a dedicated and ambitious team of colleagues who manage scientific activities related to grant awarding, both strategic and in open competition. We work in a project-centric fashion with strong and synergistic collaboration across all NNF programme areas, and with key external partners such as universities, research centres, and companies.

Your colleagues at NNF work across the entire value chain in the core areas, from STEM teaching to university research, innovation, and to industrial uptake of the core areas. In multi-disciplinary teams you will create impact by developing, implementing, and executing existing as well as and new grants and standalone initiatives. Also, you will participate in defining novel research directions within the core areas and in crossing over to other disciplines.

The Job

For this position, the relevant core areas are data science, computational science, AI, as well as the interface to quantum. Also, NNF has an ambition to increase application of these areas within health and sustainability, with the overarching purpose to overcome societal and planetary challenges. Today, the Foundation has a portfolio that consists of a dedicated open-competition programme, as well as several significant strategic grants supporting, e.g., the Danish Data Science Academy, the Pioneer Centre for AI, as well as Gefion, the novel national AI-dedicated supercomputer established in collaboration with NVIDIA.

A part of the job will be to support the current portfolio, another part of the job will be to expand the portfolio in a relevant direction, for instance in the development in applications toward biomedicine, or at the interface to quantum.

You will be responsible for the daily management and handling of scientific reporting, and for development of strategic grants related to research initiatives within data science. In addition, you will be involved in open competition programmes, including managing the implementation, day-to-day operations, and follow-ups.

Your tasks will include:


Participate in, or be responsible for designing, implementing, and running new funding programmes in open competition and establishing new strategic initiatives within the Nat-Tech department as well as in cross-organisational project teams.
Being at the forefront of the field, which includes staying on top of relevant scientific literature, analysing and evaluating received applications, and participating in scientific conferences.
Formulating the content of reports, recommendations, and other written documents clearly and professionally.
Maintaining communication with evaluation committees and providing guidance to applicants and stakeholders.
Engage - and build trusted relations - with stakeholders in the ecosystem of the core areas and help NNF develop the ecosystem further.
Running committee meetings and identifying peer-reviewers for calls with external reviewers.
Supporting the Nat-Tech programme area in handling unsolicited applications within your areas of expertise.



Professional And Personal Qualifications

We are looking for a scientific expert with:


A PhD degree in computational science, data science or related area, for instance math or physics, involving handling of big data
Demonstrated track record within fundamental research in the core areas, ideally with +3 years of postdoctoral experience, preferably from international research environments and/or relevant private industry
Preferably proficiency in data science algorithms and models, such as machine learning, large language models etc.
A well-established network and comprehensive understanding of the relevant scientific and innovation community/ecosystem
Experience in research management may be an advantage
Experience with funding applications and budget handling may be an advantage
Project management skills will be an advantage


As a person you are intellectual quick and curious also outside your own professional domain. You thrive in collaborative environments and are adept at working with various stakeholders across the organisation.

Your colleagues describe you as helpful and easy to work with and are known being an excellent and engaging communicator of research results.

Working at the Novo Nordisk Foundation

We offer a committed and professional workplace in which we value that our colleagues thrive, are challenged, and have opportunities to develop their potential. A career at the Novo Nordisk Foundation gives you the opportunity to work:


on important projects that benefit society
with key actors within research and industry
as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating value for society.



Application and Information

For more information, please contact Scientific Director Morten Bache (email: mba@novo.dk) or Senior Vice President Lene Oddershede (email: lod@novo.dk). We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible, and no later than 20 October 2024.

To apply, please send your CV, cover letter and university transcripts by clicking on the "Apply now" button.

About The Novo Nordisk Foundation 

Established in Denmark in 1924, the Novo Nordisk Foundation is an enterprise foundation with philanthropic objectives. The vision of the Foundation is to improve people's health and the sustainability of society and the planet. The Foundation's mission is to progress research and innovation in the prevention and treatment of cardiometabolic and infectious diseases as well as to advance knowledge and solutions to support a green transformation of society.  
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you intrigued by the crossroads of business intelligence (BI), data analytics, process enhancement, and stakeholder management? Does your expertise lie in digitalisation and simplifying complex issues, with an eagerness to apply them in a strategic sourcing environment?

If this resonates with you, we look forward to welcoming your talent and expertise in Strategic Sourcing Inbound Materials & Services (SSIMS), Sourcing Intelligence & Business Support, where you’ll play a key role in bringing our ambitious strategic vision to life. Apply now!

The position
As Data Scientist, you'll be a crucial player in our transition towards advanced analytics, leveraging your data interpretation and modelling expertise to cater to our specific use cases. Your tasks involve consistent interaction with stakeholders from SSIMS/ Global Strategic Outsourcing & Devices (GSOD), comprehending their operations, and aiding in the progression of business intelligence projects.

With a focus on teamwork, you team up with BI cluster members to ensure your collective projects are ready for digitization, learning and integrating best practices from one another. As part of a team of six, you'll strategize on optimally distributing responsibilities related to existing and upcoming solutions, considering specific skills, interests, development objectives, and overall priorities.

Your key responsibilities entail:



Engaging in dialogue with BI associates and stakeholders, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational efficiency
Collaborating closely within and outside the department to brainstorm and develop new solutions and sourcing-related process workflows
Designing and establishing scalable digital self-service platforms, aiming to simplify accessibility to tools and data for a smoother user experience
Leveraging BI tools to extract and utilise data from various sources, driving informed decision-making and business growth
Exploring proactively emerging digital technologies and evaluating their potential impact on our innovation roadmap




As you interact with our less technically oriented business associates, part of your role will be to understand their needs and educate them about the technical capabilities and constraints within our IT ecosystem. Your place within the department will be crucial, as you will be the go-to expert for implementing the best BI solutions in line with their functional requirements.

Qualifications

To be successful in this role, we believe you:



Hold an academic background in IT, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Digital Innovation, Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field
Possess experience in digitalisation project development and implementation, coupled with a solid understanding of how data integrates within data models
Bring expertise in data analysis or analytics tools/programming languages such as Alteryx, SQL, Power Query, Python, Tableau, or Power BI
Demonstrate excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage and present complex, high volumes of data from varying sources
Showcase fluency in written and spoken English




It would be considered as a strong advantage if you are familiar with Microsoft Power Platform and/or Fabric or have experience with databases or building data pipelines.

On a personal level, you approach challenges with a structured, systematic mindset and a keen eye for details, making even complex data easy to understand. With a natural ability to apply logical reasoning, you thrive on solving problems and building innovative solutions. You enjoy working in a global, informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand, taking pride in helping your colleagues across various functions.

About The Department

SSIMS is one of the central sourcing units in Novo Nordisk’s Product Supply division, responsible for medium- and long-term strategic sourcing activities, which involves global identification and strategic management of suppliers for Novo Nordisk’s worldwide pharmaceutical production sites. We also work with – and support – our colleagues in our sister unit, GSOD.

You will be part of Sourcing Intelligence & Business Support CoE, where we drive cross-unit assessment and projects, represent the unit in different fora outside our area and contribute with value-adding sparring to the category management and sourcing departments in SSIMS/GSOD. The disciplines that we represent and tailor for include sourcing/scenario analytics, financial advisory, market intelligence, quality management and business intelligence.

You will enter a thorough, yet fast-paced and ambitious environment, where we collaborate closely with stakeholders inside and outside the sourcing units. The office is in the Product Supply HQ in Bagsværd (note that in December we will relocate to Taastrup), where 20 talented colleagues in the Sourcing Intelligence & Business Support CoE look forward to welcoming you.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact Senior Manager Jacob Berget on ojob@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
7 October 2024.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

The office is in the Product Supply HQ in Bagsværd (note that in December we will relocate to Taastrup), where 20 talented colleagues in the Sourcing Intelligence & Business Support CoE look forward to welcoming you.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
For further information, please contact Senior Manager Jacob Berget on ojob@novonordisk.com.

Deadline
7 October 2024.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?




AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—




Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modeling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, etc.




AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 80+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do




You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with seven other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Tech department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.

Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education, preferably from a social science background specializing in statistics and data analysis or a numerically oriented education.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create business insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, including various regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and machine learning models.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analyzing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioral data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages customers.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer




A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.




Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application




If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form: https://share.hsforms.com/15Mw2OSWQQo-N78GVJfcsNw21v9v.




The deadline for applications is October 20th, 2024. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to receiving your application!

For a client, emagine is looking for a Data Scientist.

Data Science: Good knowledge of data science basics with a focus on having experience within GenAI space.

Title: Platform Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Our Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading

Platform Engineer (Python) in Copenhagen

This summer, we’re expanding our Tech Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading. We are seeking platform engineers with a software development background, preferably in Python, and with experience in making critical technological choices, designing, and implementing data stores and pipelines, and producing high-quality software with a keen focus on delivering value.

If your skills and interests align with this opportunity, and you're excited about working for a company dedicated to the energy transition, consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Copenhagen Energy Trading.

As a young and rapidly expanding energy trading firm, we welcome candidates with varying levels of experience. So don’t hesitate to apply if you only have a few years under your belt.

About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you’ll be joining our Tech Team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the critical infrastructure and platform services powering our analytics and many of our business functions.

You will get to develop resilient front-end and back-end applications, understand and codify complex business logic, automate tests, define infrastructure-as-code and workflow deployments declaratively - and much more, but everything as code. We are a bunch of Pythonistas, but we're also flexible and open towards other languages, if needed.

What is especially intriguing about this role is the direct impact your contributions can have on the improvement of our trading operations. You will be seated close to your trading colleagues, which makes it easy to collaborate and share new ideas on how we can make our solutions even better.

The position will be based at our headquarters located in the district of Carlsberg City in Central Copenhagen.

Responsibilities

Software: Design and implement scalable, reliable, and efficient software solutions, including data pipelines for ingesting and transforming data. Help set and follow software best practices to influence the way we build, document, review and test our software. You must be a fighter of technical debt in code bases.
Infrastructure & Cloud: Work on enhancing our platform infrastructure spanning the entire data lifecycle from ingestion and data transformation to machine-learning model management and reporting. We are cloud-native and run on Azure. You and the team are responsible for developing and securing our cloud infrastructure.
Automation & DevOps: Automate processes and optimize DevOps practices to streamline development and deployment environments.
Security and Compliance: Ensure security, performance, and compliance standards in everything we do.
Containerization: Leverage containerization for deploying our applications, while ensuring the reliability and security of the containerized applications throughout their lifecycle.
Analysis: Conduct various ad hoc analyses to assist in decision-making processes. Often, this will involve running proof-of-concept experiments on new technologies and tools to enhance the platform’s capabilities.
Support: Participate in on-call rotations for platform support and maintenance, assisting in troubleshooting platform-related issues, and occasionally addressing other technology-related concerns within the company.

Qualifications and Experience

Education: A master’s or bachelor’s degree with a strong technological basis, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other relevant fields.
Software Development Experience: Proven proficiency in crafting Python software solutions that are not only functional but also production ready. Ideally, your experience should encompass managing challenges related to scalability, performance, and reliability.
Python Proficiency: A strong command of Python programming language is a must. If Event loops, context managers, type-hints and generators are all parts of your vocabulary, then that is awesome.
DevOps and Deployment: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes) is advantageous. You should be comfortable deploying applications to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. Big plus, if you have experience in achieving parity between production, staging and dev.
Database Skills: Some experience with database design, development, and optimization, preferably with PostgreSQL would be great.
Communication Skills: Excellent problem-solving and communication skills with full professional proficiency in English.
Electricity markets: A genuine interest in learning about electricity markets.
Technology-enthusiast: A strong enthusiasm for staying up to date with emerging technologies is like icing on the cake.

What We Offer

At Copenhagen Energy, we're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where your talents and contributions are recognized and valued. When you join our team, you'll benefit from:

Exceptional Team: Join a team of professional and highly ambitious colleagues who continuously set the bar high, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the energy trading market. We do not use either SAFe or Scrum but follow a Kanban-style iterative approach towards agility. We fight technical debt and muda, mura and muri in every process.
Thrilling growth environment: Be a part of a young and rapidly growing company with an authentic start-up atmosphere. Here, your innovative ideas will be celebrated, and your contributions will be recognized.
Impact: Be part of a visionary organization driving positive change in the energy sector, and impact how we become more technology driven as an organization.
Attractive compensation: Receive a competitive salary package with benefits.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We value work-life balance and offer the freedom to work from the comfort of your own home.
Social and Professional Events: Enjoy a well-rounded work experience with various social and professional events, including sports activities and parties, fostering a strong team spirit and camaraderie.

About Us

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.

We specialize in short-term proprietary wholesale power trading in Europe. We work with modern technologies, and we have the best people working with us. Data and advanced analytics fuel our deep insights into the electricity markets and enable us to develop discretionary as well as system-based trading strategies that move power to where it is needed the most.

Since we believe in a culture of collaborative growth, we do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.

Next steps

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. For more information you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen jcj@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more
