Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our highly-skilled development team in Copenhagen is seeking a versatile Senior Data Scientist with a passion for formalism, heuristics and algorithms as well as an understanding of software engineering. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions. LiveIntent Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the company's next generation technology in close collaboration with the company's other departments in New York and Berlin.

Our team in Copenhagen consists of a couple of hand picked veterans from the start-up environment as well as 30 handpicked highly competent and focused colleagues who have joined since the end of 2016. Both the level of competence and focus is therefore very high and for that reason, many exciting tasks are constantly flowing from the rest of the organization to Copenhagen. We want to expand the team with more skilled and innovative talents and we are looking for both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, but prefer people with an interest in both areas of work.

About The Job

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for LiveIntent Copenhagen, who can analyze issues based on data, and design, develop and maintain algorithms, reports and software solutions for LiveIntent. This person will largely be able to plan, choose and organize their own tasks, but will also be expected to work closely with the other team developers and stakeholders in the company's international product division. The Senior Data Scientist will be part of all stages of development, from initial sparring and exchange of ideas to prototyping, development, testing, deployment, maintenance / improvement and reporting, but with the expected focus on the first three parts. We believe in flexibility under responsibility, and our development process is therefore a loosely defined hybrid of agile methods and rapid prototyping. Our Ideal Candidate:


Has experience with data analysis and software development from other positions.
Is interested in translating real world issues into mathematical models, mathematical statistics and algorithms.
Ideally also has an interest in programming (in several languages), in machine learning and / or adtech technology.
Has one of the heavier mathematical educations such as computer science, mathematics or physics.
Has several years of practical experience with real programming, practical and / or deep theoretical understanding of some of the following: Classical statistics (hypothesis tests, confidence intervals), Data mining, ETL processing, machine Learning, Probabilistic graphical models (eg Markov logic networks or Bayesian networks), Data Processing in MapReduce using Hadoop / Cascading / Scalding, Programming in Scala, Python programming, Data reporting and ad hoc analysis in Athena, Google BigQuery or the "PyLab" suite.
Has experience mentoring and guiding other team members in a previous role.


Our ideal candidate attacks problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. This person is full of good ideas, able to see opportunities in other people's ideas, and can find out about ideas in a distanced and constructive way. They love thinking about many issues and connecting them with data. Our ideal Senior Data Scientist candidate understands that finding new facets of data is more important than adjusting meta parameters to algorithms. They are happy to implement and optimize and are curious about new tasks.

We're looking for someone who will be excited to understand and involve themselves in the company's problem areas and can communicate in English with management and colleagues at the other LiveIntent offices. This person will be immersed in a dynamic environment where overall priorities and definitions will change over time, and therefore tasks will not always be prioritized. This person will work independently and take initiative.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the world’s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the hashed email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies don’t work. LiveIntent enriches a brand’s data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent has offices located in New York, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to both learn from and mentor others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, so while this position is located in our Copenagen office, there is frequent collaboration between the teams in Berlin and New York City.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.


Show more
HTML:
Our highly-skilled development team in Copenhagen is seeking a versatile Senior Data Scientist with a passion for formalism, heuristics and algorithms as well as an understanding of software engineering. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions. LiveIntent Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the company's next generation technology in close collaboration with the company's other departments in New York and Berlin.

Our team in Copenhagen consists of a couple of hand picked veterans from the start-up environment as well as 30 handpicked highly competent and focused colleagues who have joined since the end of 2016. Both the level of competence and focus is therefore very high and for that reason, many exciting tasks are constantly flowing from the rest of the organization to Copenhagen. We want to expand the team with more skilled and innovative talents and we are looking for both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, but prefer people with an interest in both areas of work.

About The Job

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for LiveIntent Copenhagen, who can analyze issues based on data, and design, develop and maintain algorithms, reports and software solutions for LiveIntent. This person will largely be able to plan, choose and organize their own tasks, but will also be expected to work closely with the other team developers and stakeholders in the company's international product division. The Senior Data Scientist will be part of all stages of development, from initial sparring and exchange of ideas to prototyping, development, testing, deployment, maintenance / improvement and reporting, but with the expected focus on the first three parts. We believe in flexibility under responsibility, and our development process is therefore a loosely defined hybrid of agile methods and rapid prototyping. Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Has experience with data analysis and software development from other positions.
  • Is interested in translating real world issues into mathematical models, mathematical statistics and algorithms.
  • Ideally also has an interest in programming (in several languages), in machine learning and / or adtech technology.
  • Has one of the heavier mathematical educations such as computer science, mathematics or physics.
  • Has several years of practical experience with real programming, practical and / or deep theoretical understanding of some of the following: Classical statistics (hypothesis tests, confidence intervals), Data mining, ETL processing, machine Learning, Probabilistic graphical models (eg Markov logic networks or Bayesian networks), Data Processing in MapReduce using Hadoop / Cascading / Scalding, Programming in Scala, Python programming, Data reporting and ad hoc analysis in Athena, Google BigQuery or the "PyLab" suite.
  • Has experience mentoring and guiding other team members in a previous role.

Our ideal candidate attacks problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. This person is full of good ideas, able to see opportunities in other people's ideas, and can find out about ideas in a distanced and constructive way. They love thinking about many issues and connecting them with data. Our ideal Senior Data Scientist candidate understands that finding new facets of data is more important than adjusting meta parameters to algorithms. They are happy to implement and optimize and are curious about new tasks.

We're looking for someone who will be excited to understand and involve themselves in the company's problem areas and can communicate in English with management and colleagues at the other LiveIntent offices. This person will be immersed in a dynamic environment where overall priorities and definitions will change over time, and therefore tasks will not always be prioritized. This person will work independently and take initiative.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the world’s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the hashed email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies don’t work. LiveIntent enriches a brand’s data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent has offices located in New York, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to both learn from and mentor others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, so while this position is located in our Copenagen office, there is frequent collaboration between the teams in Berlin and New York City.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.

Title: Algorithm Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Reel to build the digital infrastructure for the renewable energy transition.

In A Nutshell


Electricity accounts for 2/3 of global greenhouse gas emissions. Reel is rethinking electricity procurement to accelerate the renewable energy transition and reduce emissions.
We are building the leading B2B electricity supplier in Europe. We are live in the market and are on a trajectory to drive impact at scale.
As a workplace, we value trust, autonomy, and time for focused deep work.
You are a kind, driven and enthusiastic person, with a genuine sense about sustainability issues.
You have experience in automation and software, an interest in trading, and want to put your skills to use in a highly purpose-driven, supportive and collaborative organization.
For more info on Reel, see our careers page.


How You Can Contribute

The Impact You Will Make

As our new Algorithm Developer, you will be helping us develop a state of the art continuous trading platform for the physical power market. You will work directly with Edoardo, our Head of Trading and Flexibility, and Christian, our CTO, and the rest of the tech team to build the digital infrastructure for the renewable energy transition.

This is a high impact role where you will work for a climate tech company. Your work will be integral to helping companies reduce their CO₂ emissions and decarbonize our electricity grid by lowering costs for developers of new renewable infrastructure.

What You Will Work On

These are some (not all) of the things you will be working on:


Develop and iteratively improve our 24/7 trading platform for the continuous intraday market.
Conceptualize and deploy trading strategies to lower the cost of balancing renewables and extract value from flexible assets and proprietary trading.
Collaborate with quantitative traders, data scientists and software developers building trading systems and strategies.
Build out best-in-class data pipelines handling vast amounts of data.
Take part in making key technical decisions, such as what to build in-house and what to outsource, or our backend architecture.
Perform code reviews, sharing constructive feedback with your colleagues.
Take ownership of the operations of our platform alongside your team members.
Keep a high level of technical quality, introducing new best practices, and keeping our systems up to date.


How You Can Thrive In This Role

You are enthusiastic about having a real impact on climate change. You are motivated by achieving results in the real world and are comfortable with making trade-offs between speed and quality.

In addition, you will have some (not necessarily all) of the following traits:


Enjoy working on projects all the way from 0 to 1 and shipping multiple times a week.
Have 3+ years of professional experience working with software engineering or quantitative analytics deployed in production.
Have worked with automated trading or other 24/7 critical systems.
Have developed and deployed algorithms taking decisions with a combination of hand-written logic and predictive models.
Enjoy working with an iterative approach and you never let the perfect be the enemy of the good.
Value learning and growing your skillset with support from your team, and appreciate the value of honest and kind feedback.
Thrive working in an environment with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility, but are also not afraid to reach out and ask for help.
Our trading platform is written in Python and hosted on Google Cloud and Fly.io. The backend and data pipelines are written in Elixir using the Phoenix framework. Data is in BigQuery. Experience with Python is required, experience with the rest of the stack is a nice-to-have.


At Reel, we offer you an organization that cares as much for its people as for the climate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where we believe that your personal growth and well-being is imperative. Diversity is celebrated, and we believe that all of our employees' unique perspectives and experiences drive innovation, creativity, and the success of our business.

What We Offer You

Beyond our people, culture, and mission, we aim to provide you with a workplace environment where you can grow both professionally and personally. We offer an attractive base salary that reflects your skills and experience as well as a generous warrant program for all full-time employees, allowing you to share in our success.

Benefits


Vacation: Enjoy 30 days (5 weeks + 1) of paid holidays to recharge.
Pension: Benefit from an attractive employer-supported pension scheme, including health insurance.
Parental leave: Take advantage of our generous parental leave policy.
Equipment: Choose your preferred IT setup (Mac, Windows, etc.) with a budget of 25,000 DKK.
Learning: Grow your skills with an annual 4,000 DKK learning and development budget.
Office: Experience our vibrant office-first culture in our beautiful waterside location in Christianshavn, with a flexible work-from-home or remote work policy.
Lunch: Enjoy employer-supported catered lunch at the office every day.
Socials: Join us for monthly social events and bi-annual offsites, fostering a strong team spirit.
Visa: We support non-EU residents by sponsoring VISAs.


Interested?

We are very excited hearing from you. You can find more information about the interview process on our career page.

You don't feel like you fulfill all the criteria?

We know that 'perfect' candidates do not exist. The only thing you need to ensure is that the problem we are solving at Reel is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning.

We encourage all candidates, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religious beliefs, etc. to apply.

  • Visa: We support non-EU residents by sponsoring VISAs.

We are very excited hearing from you. You can find more information about the interview process on our career page.

You don't feel like you fulfill all the criteria?

We know that 'perfect' candidates do not exist. The only thing you need to ensure is that the problem we are solving at Reel is one you cannot wait to get out of bed for on Monday morning.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more

Title: Senior Safety Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your experience with data science might be just what we’re looking for.
You can be part of transformational initiatives that will impact the field of patient safety.
Your enthusiasm for providing data-based insights will help us progress our understanding of the safety of our products for the benefit of patients.
Your skillset and contributions will enable us to make efficient business decisions.



Your new role

As Senior Safety Data Scientist, you’ll play an important role in shaping our digital transformation journey. You’ll leverage your data science expertise to advance our safety case management and signal detection processes across a variety of data sources. You’ll have the freedom to explore and implement solutions in a collaborative, cross-functional environment. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of patient safety, working closely with key global stakeholders across Global Patient Safety, R&D, IT and external partners.

Your future team

GPS Technologies is part of Global Patient Safety. You will join our team of 5 colleagues who values expertise and a hands-on approach to transforming business needs into robust technical realities. Our culture is characterized by a flat hierarchy that encourages swift decision-making, where every colleague is a key player, and every day is an opportunity to collaborate, develop, and make a tangible impact. Join us and be part of a team that not only excels professionally but also values the joy of camaraderie and shared success.

The position is based in our offices in Valby, Denmark.

What You Bring To The Team


Experience with applying Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to both structured and unstructured data sources, including internal safety data, real world data (RWD), digital health (DH) applications.
Proficiency in creating and implementing self-service analytical tools and frameworks.
Strong problem-solving capabilities and advanced analytical skills, and the ability to comprehend and apply complex concepts through abstract reasoning.
Advanced communication and interpersonal skills.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation for applying. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions, please contact Signe Vognsen, Senior Director, svog@lundbeck.com. Applications must be received by 06th October 2024.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#AdvancingBrainHealth #FocusedInnovator

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!

Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.


We also think our new colleague have experience from:

  • Python or Java
  • SQL
  • Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
  • Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)


It is meritorious if you also have:

  • experience of UX design
  • experience working with control algorithms
  • experience of version control systems


Location: Aarhus, Denmark.


The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!


As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers


About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Place: Høje-Taastrup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Are you passionate about starting or pursuing a career in the renewable energy industry, with a focus on embedded laser systems in a global context? Then embark on a transformative journey with us as we continue to reshape the wind energy landscape!




Windar Photonics is a globally recognized leader in LiDAR-based optimization solutions for the wind energy industry. Established in 2008 as a spin-off from DTU-Risø (Technical University of Denmark), we employ a diverse and dedicated team of 35 professionals across our offices in Denmark and China.




Our pioneering WindEYE and WindVISION LiDAR systems are used worldwide by leading wind turbine manufacturers and major wind-farm owners. These advanced optical units, utilizing light reflection and the Doppler effect principles, equip wind turbine controllers with precise wind measurements. This is all achieved in the demanding conditions at the top of the nacelle.




The Role

We are seeking a dedicated and motivated Embedded Software Engineer to join our agile and autonomous development team. In this role, you will be tasked with maintaining and enhancing the quality of our existing and future products. Your work will involve designing, developing, documenting, and testing software solutions that incorporate logical and mathematical components to drive business/project features. You will participate in the entire development cycle, gaining insights into cutting-edge optical measurement devices.




Your Profile

The ideal candidate will have most of the following qualifications:

Proficiency in programming, in both bare metal and Linux environments.
Proficiency in shell scripting.
Demonstrated experience with code writing on microcontrollers with small memory footprints.
Experience with debugging tools and techniques.
Good understanding of software development methodologies and life cycle processes.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
Ideally a good understanding of various hardware and peripheral interfaces.
Experience with board bring up and bootloader customisation is an advantage.




We are looking for hands-on, cross-discipline, team-player with:

An analytical mindset and excellent technical problem-solving skills,
A degree within computer science, engineering, natural sciences or similar,
0-3 years of relevant work experience,
An autonomous and proactive attitude,
Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)




Join us as we make strides towards a more sustainable future powered by renewable energy! Your unique skills and expertise as an embedded C programmer will be an integral part of this journey.




Want to apply?

Please send your cover letter and CV to the Head of Software Engineering, Devashish Bhageerutty, at db@windarphotonics.com.

Applications will be processed continuously so do not hesitate to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


Skills: javascript,aws,angular,python,aws/gcp,sql,nestjs,typescript,gcp,nest.js,full stack development,react

Title: Full Stack Developer for Green Tech Solutions
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in shaping the future of biodiversity and environmental sustainability.




Are you passionate about building innovative technology to make a positive environmental impact? Do you have solid experience working with PHP and Laravel, and a structured approach to development? If so, FaunaPhotonics is looking for a Full Stack Developer like you to help us continuously improve and innovate our customer portal. 

 

 

About FaunaPhotonics 

At FaunaPhotonics, we are at the forefront of insect monitoring, providing essential data to support biodiversity preservation. Our IoT sensor technologies capture insect activity, which is processed and analyzed in our Data Lake using AI. The resulting biodiversity insights are presented to our customers through our customer portal, enabling them to take informed action and document their impact on biodiversity. In doing so, we help drive sustainable solutions for the planet. 

 

We’re a team of approximately 15 professionals working out of our office in Nordhavn. Our work environment embraces agile development, cross-functional collaboration, and a culture of innovation. We prioritize open dialogue, fail-fast experimentation, and an entrepreneurial mindset as we pursue our shared vision. 

 

Your Role 

We launched our new customer portal in April, built with PHP and Laravel and hosted on AWS. It integrates with our IoT sensor technologies, offering near-time insights into ecosystem health. Now, we are focused on improving the portal based on customer feedback and simplifying the way we present eco-system health data. 

 

As a Full Stack Developer, you will be an integral part of this process. You will help refine existing features, develop new functionalities, and drive innovation in the user experience. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

Enhance and improve our customer portal by leveraging customer feedback. 
Build intuitive, user-friendly interfaces for presenting complex biodiversity and insect activity data. 
Work closely with our team to integrate new technologies and maintain a scalable infrastructure on AWS. 
Collaborate in an agile environment with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation. 

 

What We're Looking For 

5 years of experience with PHP, preferably Laravel. 
DevOps experience, cloud infrastructure, and deployment on AWS. 
Frontend experience building interfaces with ReactJS. 
A structured individual who can work methodically, focusing on scalability and maintainability. 
Proven experience building and maintaining web applications. 
An ability to innovate and simplify the presentation of data in customer-facing environments. 
A passion for environmental sustainability and creating impactful technology. 
Familiarity with agile development and cross-functional collaboration. 

 

Why FaunaPhotonics? 

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a company where technology meets environmental impact. You will contribute directly to a product that aids in tracking biodiversity and fostering a sustainable future. 

 

Interested? 

We invite you to reach out to us with your vision and technical approach. Share how you would tackle this challenge and contribute to FaunaPhotonics’ mission. 

We’re not looking for a typical CV submission process—we’d love to converse beyond the traditional interview format. We're excited to hear your ideas and explore how you might fit into our team. 

 

Contact 

For more information, connect with Niels Krebs, Chief Technology Officer, at NIKR@faunaphotonics.com or call +45 22 69 74 61 

 

Note to recruiters and consultancies: We are handling this recruitment entirely in-house, and we are not interested in external proposals or pitches at this time.

Title: Backend Developer (Python)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
emagine is looking for an experienced Backend Developer with strong Python skills to join a product team for one of our clients in the pharmaceutical industry. The product is set to launch in November, and we need a talented developer to help ensure its success.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with the Product Owner, UI/UX Designer, Frontend Developer, Data Scientist, and Data Engineer to deliver a high-quality product
Develop and maintain backend services and APIs
Design and implement microservices architecture
Write unit, integration, and performance tests, and debug code when necessary
Utilize Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for orchestration
Work with Azure DevOps for CI/CD processes


Required Skills and Experience:


Proficiency in Python with proven experience in backend development
Experience with SQL databases
Strong understanding and experience in building/designing REST APIs
Familiarity with microservices architecture
Experience with Git, Docker, and Kubernetes
Experience using Azure DevOps for CI/CD processes


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in writing unit, integration, and performance tests


Location: Bagsværd, Denmark

Start Date: ASAP

End Date: 12-01-2025

Allocation: Full time, time & material

Title: Frontend Developer
Description:
We Compare søger for Homerunner




En dynamisk Frontend Developer med Vue.Js skills, der ønsker at bruge sin kreativitet og arbejde med produkter der er lysår foran alle andre




Træd ind i Homerunner´s spændende univers, hvor de ikke blot laver historie - de skriver den om med deres innovationer. Dette er ikke bare et job, det er en invitation til at forme fremtiden med Homerunner og sætte dit præg på historien.




Hvorfor Homerunner

Hos Homerunner har man en stærk moderne filosofi, der gør dette til en forfriskende anderledes arbejdsplads og derfor tror man også på, at den stærkeste ledelse kommer fra at forstå og engagere sig i mennesker på et dybt niveau.

Det er din leders evne til at forstå og håndtere menneskelige relationer, også kendt som emotionel intelligens, der er grundstenen i deres tilgang til ledelse og en strategisk prioritet hos Homerunner.




Vi ser derfor også på din egen evne til at opbygge tillidsfulde relationer på tværs i huset og med kunder og forstå komplekse dynamikker, som en vigtig brik og en afgørende del for at skabe et miljø, hvor innovation og vækst kan blomstre.




Et lille eksempel herpå vil være, at du i opgaveløsningen ikke får færdigdefinerede opgaver, men du vil derimod qua dine kompetencer indenfor frontend udvikling, dit kendskab til at vide hvilke relationer man skal tage fat i for at få alle de væsentlige perspektiver og din kreativitet kunne løse opgaverne med størst succes.




Når du træder ind på de lækre kontorer hos Homerunner, vil du med det samme mærke en ånd og kultur, der oser af passion, innovation og du vil opleve at der er lys i øjnene på medarbejderne... ganske enkelt en anderledes arbejdsplads.




Hos Homerunner er alle kolleger forskellige med differentierede styrker, men deres fællesnævner er...

Man skal kunne stortrives i et dynamisk entreprenant ungt miljø med stor kreativ frihed, samt frihed til at forme din egen arbejdsdag og vælge de metoder, der passer bedst til dig.
Man har ikke noget imod at blive kastet ud på dybt vand (fagligt) og som ønsker at udvikle sig sammen med huset på jeres spændende rejse.
Alle har en holdning til håndværket og bruger deres sunde kritiske sans og deltager gerne i en faglig debat for at rykke baren, men er pragmatisk i forhold til også at acceptere andres ideer og metoder.
Man arbejder, fordi man besidder en stor portion passion for udvikling og dét at skabe værdi for brugerne af systemet.
Man har et generelt positivt mindset og lyst til samarbejde på tværs i huset.
Man er god til at sætter sig ind i kundens problematikker.
Man er åben, relations skabende, positiv og ansvarlig, motiverende og videns delende.




Hvem leder vi efter...

Vi leder efter dig der besidder en stor passion for frontend udvikling og en evne til at træffe velovervejede beslutninger på vegne af den gode løsning.

Dig der har en evne til at forstå komplekse sammenhænge og samtidig navigere gennem menneskelige relationer, da dette vil være afgørende for din succes.




Kompetencer

Du kan se dig selv i ovenstående fællesnævner.
IT uddannelse og/ eller stor passion og erfaring inden for frontend udvikling, men husk vi ansætter passionerede mennesker og ikke blot et cv.
Stærke frontend kompetencer indenfor Vue.js 3 (potentiel 2) og lyst til på sigt at arbejde med GO og kontinuerligt tilegne dig nye technologier.
Du behersker dansk og engelsk på højt niveauer.
Lyst til at komme på kontoret dagligt, få lækker frokost og sparre med dine kolleger




Hvis du er den vi beskriver og har en passion for frontend udvikling og mennesker og ønsker at være en del af et team, der udfordrer status quo, så er dette jobbet for dig!




Din nye lækre arbejdsplads

Homerunner er netop flyttet i nye lækre lokaler i Østerågade 27 i Aalborg

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/homerunner-com_i-dag-er-vi-flyttet-til-vores-nye-kontor-activity-7211789099010039808-UmVR/




Så hvis DU er klar til at tage fat på en rejse, hvor dine færdigheder vil blive udfordret på det højeste niveau, og brænder for at være med til at forme fremtiden for en hel galakse, så send os din ansøgning til her på LinkedIn eller på tka@wecompare.dk og lad os sammen tage et møde og tale ind til og komme omkring en potentiel spændende fremtid hos Homerunner.




Ved spørgsmål kan du også kontakte Tanja Kaysen hos We Compare

på +45 93 83 83 54




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig allerede i dag, da vi holder løbende samtaler!

Title: Azure Devops Engineer
Description:
You could use your +7 years of experience as a DEVOPS engineer, mainly on AZURE at our place, and become amazing.




Working with us is about growing your enthusiasm for hosting and scaling applications, not just reaching deadlines. To focus daily without interruption, we recognise the need for solitude.




Claus, our founder, collects happy employees. One of them wrote this on his LinkedIn:




"Claus has broad technical knowledge as well as good people skills." He never makes assumptions and always asks the appropriate questions.

He is a motivator who has never brought about a negative circumstance. He's also humorous and a pleasure to work with, which makes Monday mornings more enjoyable."




Our culture is engagement, focus, feedback, and repeat. Every achievement is rewarded, and we will recognise it on your own LinkedIn profile.




Together, we will build software applications for customers in Scandinavia.

Show more
HTML:
You could use your +7 years of experience as a DEVOPS engineer, mainly on AZURE at our place, and become amazing.


Working with us is about growing your enthusiasm for hosting and scaling applications, not just reaching deadlines. To focus daily without interruption, we recognise the need for solitude.


Claus, our founder, collects happy employees. One of them wrote this on his LinkedIn:


"Claus has broad technical knowledge as well as good people skills." He never makes assumptions and always asks the appropriate questions.

He is a motivator who has never brought about a negative circumstance. He's also humorous and a pleasure to work with, which makes Monday mornings more enjoyable."


Our culture is engagement, focus, feedback, and repeat. Every achievement is rewarded, and we will recognise it on your own LinkedIn profile.


Together, we will build software applications for customers in Scandinavia.

Title: Full Stack Developer ( Python/Flask)
Description:
🚀 Join Our Dynamic Team at Spotipo! 🚀

Position: Python/Flask Full Stack Developer

Salary: Up to $50,000/year

Experience: Minimum 5 years

Are You a Coding Maestro with a Love for Python?

At Spotipo, we're a small, tightly-knit team of tech enthusiasts passionate about delivering top-notch code at lightning speed to a diverse global clientele. From local mom-and-pop shops to massive corporations, we help improve the WiFi experience for thousands of guests worldwide. And we're looking for YOU to join our journey!

What You’ll Be Doing (what's a Must-have)


Crafting high-quality applications using Flask and solid Python expertise
Playing with Docker, MySQL/Redis, Linux, and Git (Github/Gitlab)
Enhancing our codebase with HTML/JavaScript and exploring new technologies like HTMX/Tailwind


Bonus Points If You Know


Celery, Faust-streaming, Clickhouse
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Tailwind, Alpine.js
Networking/WiFi knowledge


Tools We Love & Use


GitHub
PyCharm
Buddy (CI)
Selenium (Testing)
Linear


Why You’ll Love Working With Us


Fully Remote: Work from anywhere you feel most productive
Flexible Timing: We believe in results, not clock-watching
Awesome Gear: Choose a MacBook or laptop that suits you
Endless Learning: From processing millions of events with Celery to optimizing Clickhouse queries, there's always something new to tackle


Exciting Times Ahead!

We're moving from React to HTMX/Tailwind, so if you're eager to experiment and innovate, now’s your chance!

Ready to Make an Impact?

Apply now, and let’s create something unique together!
Show more

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for our next Senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our SRE team which is located in a group of teams called, the Developer Platform Group, consisting of Security, Developer Experience, SRE, and Backend Core. You’ll work closely with these teams and cross-team collaboration is encouraged. This gives you a wonderful opportunity to continue to grow in your role and both widen and deepen your skills.

In this role, you will work with our core infrastructure, everything from how our cloud providers (AWS and GCP) are configured through Terraform to how our microservices are deployed to Kubernetes and being monitored. You can see a more detailed list below of the things we work with, we believe that you have worked in some of them and that you’ll quickly learn the rest on the job. Working with all these tools and the wide scope of the team can be daunting, but you will work in a large SRE team where teamwork is highly encouraged.

Working At Pleo

Working at Pleo means that you get to work together with hundreds of people from different backgrounds and geographies. It also means that you will get to work on challenging projects, stemming from the fact that we are a scale-up in the fintech industry and that we want to provide the best possible experience for our customers while they are dealing with their expenses.

Joining our team, you'll find that our projects can be as complex and dynamic as a Kubernetes cluster, but don't worry—every team member is like a pod, uniquely skilled, and perfectly orchestrated. And just like Kubernetes ensures no container goes unmonitored, our team camps make sure no team member goes un-caffeinated! You’ll meet up for a few days in one of our many offices and spend valuable time together as a team working on whatever you think is most important to you and your team!

Skills And Experience We Are Looking For


Datadog or any other observability stack
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Terraform
Kubernetes
Flux / GitOps
Most major AWS services
Istio
GitHub Actions
Go


Your colleagues would say you


Work in English with ease (it's our company language)
Never stop being curious and love learning about new languages/ frameworks/ working styles
Have experience solving complex technical challenges at scale
Ensure a high bar for quality and reliability within your team
Coach others to help them develop as engineers
Advocate for a more thorough code review process than a quick scroll to the bottom of the page and a “LGTM!”
You don’t just write code; you help to design the overall solution
Are sought after within your team for help in solving challenging problems
You’re a force multiplier within your team - your work enables other engineers to do even better
Able to raise and describe technical debt faced by your team. And then able to propose a solution or path forward


Show Me The Benefits


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen, and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶
All of us have a stake in Pleo’s success - ask us about our equity grant scheme


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

Title: MBT Developers - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Belmont Lavan Ltd is actively seeking talented MBT (Model-Based Testing) Developers to become part of our innovative team in Denmark. If you're passionate about software testing and have experience with model-based methodologies, we want you!

Responsibilities:


Design and develop advanced model-based testing frameworks
Engage with stakeholders to analyze system requirements and create effective testing models
Implement automated test cases derived from models to ensure comprehensive software coverage
Monitor testing results, identify defects, and liaise with development teams for swift resolution
Enhance testing methodologies to elevate software quality and efficiency
Maintain accurate documentation of testing processes and results



Requirements

Required Skills and Experience:


Strong background in software development or quality assurance with a focus on model-based testing
Proficient in the use of MBT tools and frameworks
Experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#
Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Attention to detail and a drive for high-quality outcomes
Strong communication and collaboration skills



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with performance testing or load testing tools
Knowledge of additional testing frameworks and methodologies
Industry-related experience is a bonus



Assignment Duration: Initially a 6-month contract with the possibility of extension.

Location: Denmark, with flexible options for remote work.

Required skills: Python, Java, Kubernetes, Kafka

Preferred skills: FX

Languages: English
Show more

Title: Lead AI Test Automation Engineer 10 Months Contract
Description:
we are looking for Lead AI Test Automation Engineer 🔹

We are looking for a Lead AI Test Automation Engineer who is excited about building quality AI solutions and energized about making a large impact for users and ultimately the patients of Novo Nordisk. Our applications bring cutting-edge AI innovation to thousands of scientists, data scientists, ML engineers, and users in the line of business. Our ambition is to deliver the best AI solutions tailored to Novo Nordisk, using our modern and integrated development process.

✔️Your main responsibilities include:


Create and own the test strategy for the software product
Write and maintain automated tests for various software components
Collaborate with development teams to ensure software meets quality standards
Communicate with stakeholders, including product managers, to understand requirements and ensure test coverage
Stay up to date with the latest testing tools and technologies
Integrate testing activities throughout the entire product life cycle
Utilize frameworks for UI testing



✔️We are looking for:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a similar area
7+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on automated testing
Strong knowledge of test automation frameworks and tools (UI)
Experience with test-driven development and continuous integration
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Typescript, or JavaScript
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
Understanding of software development principles and methodologies
Professional collaborative software engineering experience with Git, peer reviews
Proficiency in cloud platforms Azure and/or AWS



✔️ Nice to have:


Data integration knowledge is a plus
User research or UX experience is a plus
Basic knowledge of AI is a plus



Requirements

Required skills

Azure

Typescipt

Javascript

Python

CI/CD

Languages

English
Show more

Title: Senior Safety Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your experience with data science might be just what we’re looking for.
You can be part of transformational initiatives that will impact the field of patient safety.
Your enthusiasm for providing data-based insights will help us progress our understanding of the safety of our products for the benefit of patients.
Your skillset and contributions will enable us to make efficient business decisions.



Your new role

As Senior Safety Data Scientist, you’ll play an important role in shaping our digital transformation journey. You’ll leverage your data science expertise to advance our safety case management and signal detection processes across a variety of data sources. You’ll have the freedom to explore and implement solutions in a collaborative, cross-functional environment. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of patient safety, working closely with key global stakeholders across Global Patient Safety, R&D, IT and external partners.

Your future team

GPS Technologies is part of Global Patient Safety. You will join our team of 5 colleagues who values expertise and a hands-on approach to transforming business needs into robust technical realities. Our culture is characterized by a flat hierarchy that encourages swift decision-making, where every colleague is a key player, and every day is an opportunity to collaborate, develop, and make a tangible impact. Join us and be part of a team that not only excels professionally but also values the joy of camaraderie and shared success.

The position is based in our offices in Valby, Denmark.

What You Bring To The Team


Experience with applying Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms to both structured and unstructured data sources, including internal safety data, real world data (RWD), digital health (DH) applications.
Proficiency in creating and implementing self-service analytical tools and frameworks.
Strong problem-solving capabilities and advanced analytical skills, and the ability to comprehend and apply complex concepts through abstract reasoning.
Advanced communication and interpersonal skills.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation for applying. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions, please contact Signe Vognsen, Senior Director, svog@lundbeck.com. Applications must be received by 06th October 2024.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#AdvancingBrainHealth #FocusedInnovator

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Software Engineer to ALTEN Denmark
Description:
Are you a talented Software Engineer seeking your next opportunity? Join our Engineering team in Denmark, where exciting challenges await!

Your role as Software Engineer:

As a Software Engineer at ALTEN, you will play a key role in strengthening the section for integration of software and hardware. You will be a part of a talented team where you develop state of the art technology together with electronics engineers, firmware and software developers.

Who are you?

To be a good match for the role we we believe that you have a great experience in C++, it could be both close to the hardware or object oriented. Experience in C is also of interest. You are a driven and engaged colleague with a problem-solving mind and a team player. We also see that you have a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, or other equivalent education and at least 5+ years of experience within a relevant area.




We also think our new colleague have experience from:

Python or Java
SQL
Machine learning (TensorFloe, Scikit-learn)
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google cloud)




It is meritorious if you also have:

experience of UX design
experience working with control algorithms
experience of version control systems




Location: Aarhus, Denmark.




The recruitment process is ongoing- if you are interested do not hesitate to apply right away!




As part of our team, you can expect the following:

Full-time employment at ALTEN Denmark

Opportunities for international mobility

Access to internal education, certifications, and professional development programs offered by ALTEN Academy

Diverse range of assignments with different clients and industries

Career coaching and guidance with the support of our dedicated Business Managers




About ALTEN:

ALTEN is a leading provider of outsourced Engineering and Technology Services, operating in over 35 countries with a workforce of more than 57,000 employees. In Denmark, ALTEN has been on a successful growth trajectory since 2019, delivering innovative solutions within Engineering and Life Science. Our team of skilled engineers undertakes complex and technically demanding projects across various industries, collaborating with renowned companies throughout the value chain and are presented in various locations in Denmark!

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Vil du være med til at udvikle nogle af branchens vigtigste og mest komplekse IT-løsninger? Som Software Developer i Netcompany vil du være med til at gøre en mærkbar forskel for både vores offentlige og private kunder.

Arbejdsopgaver og teknologi

Som Software Developer vil du blive en del af vores Netcompany Application Services, der består af en fast teamstruktur, der driver porteføljer af spændende kunder og projekter. Din hverdag vil være præget af både tekniske og kunderettede opgaver med leverancer, der spænder fra nyudvikling af IT-projekter til løbende udvikling på eksisterende løsninger og serviceydelser.

I Netcompany leverer vi på alle markedsudbredte teknologier herunder .Net, C#, Java, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, Business Central ERP, Sitecore, ReactJS, Angular, Docker, Azure, Azure DevOps, Octopus, Oracle, Episerver m.fl. Valget af teknologi bestemmes altid efter, hvad der giver kunden størst værdi. Det er derfor vigtigt, at du synes, det er sjovt at arbejde med nye og varierende områder og teknologier samt finder det motiverende at udbygge din viden kontinuerligt.

Dine arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. indebære:


Kundedialog og behovsafklaring
Implementering af funktioner i brugergrænsefladen
Programmering af frontend og backend til nye features i kundens løsninger
Opsætning og udvikling af frameworks samt integrationer
Konfiguration og udvikling af extensions til standardplatforme
Automatisering af forretningsprocesser i form af f.eks. batchjobs


Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er universitetsuddannet bachelor eller diplomingeniør inden for eksempelvis datalogi, software, IT eller lignende. Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er nyuddannet eller har et par års erfaring - vigtigst er, at du brænder for at tage din karriere inden for IT til næste niveau
Besidder gode IT-tekniske kompetencer inden for objektorienteret programmering
Har et analytisk og problemløsende mindset, der gør dig i stand til at løse komplekse og tekniske opgaver for vores kunder


Fortsæt din udvikling hos os

I Netcompany har vi fokus på din personlige og faglige udvikling.

Når du starter hos os, får du en personlig mentor, som vil vejlede dig igennem din udvikling og i at nå dine mål. Den tætte relation til en erfaren kollega er med til at sikre trivsel for den enkelte medarbejder og giver dig samtidig konkret indblik i de mange forskellige karrieremuligheder, efterhånden som du opbygger din erfaring.

Derudover deltager du i vores uddannelsesprogram, Netcompany Academy, hvor du tilbydes kurser og seminarer, om alt fra teknologier til kundehåndtering. Alle kurser undervises af erfarne Netcompany kolleger, hvilket er med til at sikre, at alt indhold er af høj relevans og bygger ovenpå din faglighed, så du bliver godt klædt på til at varetage forskellige opgaver og hele tiden dygtiggør dig gennem din karriere hos os.

Bliv en del af et inkluderende fællesskab

I Netcompany prioriterer vi fællesskab højt. Vi fremmer aktivt en åben og imødekommende arbejdskultur, der bygger på samarbejde og tillid til hinanden, og hvor der altid er mulighed for sparring.

Det er en del af vores kultur og værdigrundlag, at alle medarbejdere, uanset baggrund, identitet og erfaring mødes med forståelse og respekt samt lige muligheder for udvikling og trivsel.

Du får mulighed for at opnå læring og samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af kulturer og nationaliteter, da vi som international virksomhed har kontorer i mange lande.

Vi tilbyder et fælles miljø, hvor vi engagerer os i hinanden på tværs af afdelinger og projekter. Hertil har vi en lang række af sociale og faglige arrangementer, der giver dig de bedste muligheder for at udvide og opbygge et netværk allerede tidligt i din karriere.

Send os en ansøgning

Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning til vores rekrutteringssystem via linket. Har du ikke fået svar på alle dine spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at skrive til hr.dk@netcompany.com

Alle kvalificerede kandidater opfordres til at søge uanset køn, kønsudtryk, seksualitet, handicap, alder, religion og tro, politisk anskuelse, nationalitet, etnicitet eller sociale baggrund.

Vi er engagerede i at skabe et inkluderende og mangfoldigt miljø. Vores rekrutteringsprocesser er baseret på individuel merit. Hvis du har behov for tilpasninger eller ekstra støtte under ansættelsesprocessen, bedes du sende en e-mail til vores ansvarlige rekrutteringsmedarbejdere på reasonableadjustmentsdk@netcompany.com for hjælp.

Alle kvalificerede kandidater opfordres til at søge uanset køn, kønsudtryk, seksualitet, handicap, alder, religion og tro, politisk anskuelse, nationalitet, etnicitet eller sociale baggrund.

Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Place: Høje-Taastrup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Are you passionate about starting or pursuing a career in the renewable energy industry, with a focus on embedded laser systems in a global context? Then embark on a transformative journey with us as we continue to reshape the wind energy landscape!




Windar Photonics is a globally recognized leader in LiDAR-based optimization solutions for the wind energy industry. Established in 2008 as a spin-off from DTU-Risø (Technical University of Denmark), we employ a diverse and dedicated team of 35 professionals across our offices in Denmark and China.




Our pioneering WindEYE and WindVISION LiDAR systems are used worldwide by leading wind turbine manufacturers and major wind-farm owners. These advanced optical units, utilizing light reflection and the Doppler effect principles, equip wind turbine controllers with precise wind measurements. This is all achieved in the demanding conditions at the top of the nacelle.




The Role

We are seeking a dedicated and motivated Embedded Software Engineer to join our agile and autonomous development team. In this role, you will be tasked with maintaining and enhancing the quality of our existing and future products. Your work will involve designing, developing, documenting, and testing software solutions that incorporate logical and mathematical components to drive business/project features. You will participate in the entire development cycle, gaining insights into cutting-edge optical measurement devices.




Your Profile

The ideal candidate will have most of the following qualifications:

Proficiency in programming, in both bare metal and Linux environments.
Proficiency in shell scripting.
Demonstrated experience with code writing on microcontrollers with small memory footprints.
Experience with debugging tools and techniques.
Good understanding of software development methodologies and life cycle processes.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
Ideally a good understanding of various hardware and peripheral interfaces.
Experience with board bring up and bootloader customisation is an advantage.




We are looking for hands-on, cross-discipline, team-player with:

An analytical mindset and excellent technical problem-solving skills,
A degree within computer science, engineering, natural sciences or similar,
0-3 years of relevant work experience,
An autonomous and proactive attitude,
Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)




Join us as we make strides towards a more sustainable future powered by renewable energy! Your unique skills and expertise as an embedded C programmer will be an integral part of this journey.




Want to apply?

Please send your cover letter and CV to the Head of Software Engineering, Devashish Bhageerutty, at db@windarphotonics.com.

Applications will be processed continuously so do not hesitate to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist med fokus på infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you speak data? No, I speak Python.




Perfekt. Så er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne låne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal være vores nye Data Scientist hos Danske Spil.




”Vi vælger at gå på arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambitiøse og fokuserede, men vi har også masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige data engineers sørger for al data tilrettelæggelse, så vi i Data Science kan fokusere på de reelle data science opgaver og skabe værdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi målrettet på at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team bestående af fire data scientists, en tech lead samt en product owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere state-of-the-art machine learning løsninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadfærd og relevant kundedialog i vores produkt- og marketingafdelinger. Vi har et unikt datasæt både i omfang og kvalitet, og vi brænder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver

Vi søger en erfaren og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der kan tage ansvar for vores infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at arbejde sammen med dygtige kollegaer og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og lære fra dig. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det er selvfølgelig en fordel, hvis du har hørt om Danske Spil.




Din profil:

Du har en stærk baggrund inden for data science og modellering.
Du ”taler” flydende Python.
Du har gode samarbejdsevner, en god portion nysgerrighed og erfaring med at arbejde i scrum setup.
Du har nogle års erfaring på arbejdsmarkedet indenfor Data Science.
Du har erfaring med machine learning i et cloud setup – gerne i Azure og/eller Databricks.
Du er stærk til MLOps – især CI/CD machine learning pipelines og container løsninger.
Du er en profil der ønsker at drive leverancer.




Dine opgaver:

Indgå i teamets arbejde med udvikling, drift og eventuelle bugs på vores prædiktive og generative modeller.
Ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores data science infrastruktur.
Udvikling og implementering af nye modeller og algoritmer.
Analyse af komplekse datasæt og præsentation af resultater til ledelsen.
Indgå i dialog med både forretningen og tekniske medarbejdere om relevant data til specifikke problemer.
Kommunikere modellernes performance og bagvedliggende metode bredt i organisationen.
Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ”Fail fast”-mindset.
Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.




Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem og indkalder til samtaler løbende, men deadline for at søge er til og med den 20. oktober. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Majbritt Storm Lindegaard på masb@danskespil.dk.




Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine
