Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Majbritt Storm Lindegaard på masb@danskespil.dk.


Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine

Title: Robotics Software Engineer
Place: Aalborg Municipality, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
About Us:

At Robotto, we are at the forefront of revolutionizing robotics through the integration of advanced AI, neural networks, edge computing, and computer vision technologies. We are seeking a highly skilled Robotics Software Engineer to lead the deployment of our software solutions onto robotics platforms. If you are an expert in Ardupilot, Gazebo, and MAVLink, with a strong foundation in control theory, signal processing, and proficiency in deploying software onto robotics platforms who looks at challenges and doesn't think "it can't be done" but looks for new and unique methods to find a solution, then we want you on our team.




Location: GrowAal East, Aalborg East




Role Overview:

As the Robotics Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful deployment and integration of our software onto robotics platforms. Your expertise in Ardupilot, Gazebo, and MAVLink will be instrumental in optimizing system performance, ensuring compatibility, and enabling seamless communication between software and hardware components.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead the deployment of software solutions onto robotics platforms, including configuring and tuning parameters for optimal performance.
Collaborate closely with software engineers to understand system requirements and ensure compatibility with robotics hardware.
Implement and maintain integration scripts and tools for automated deployment processes.
Troubleshoot deployment issues and provide timely resolutions to ensure smooth operation of robotic systems.
Apply expertise in control theory and signal processing to develop and optimize control algorithms, including feedforward and PID controllers, for robotic applications.




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
5+ years of experience in robotics software deployment, with expertise in Ardupilot, Gazebo, and MAVLink.
Strong understanding of robotic systems, including hardware interfaces, sensors, and actuators.
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Expertise in control theory and signal processing, with practical experience in developing and tuning feedforward and PID controllers.
Proficiency in deploying software onto robotics platforms.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Passion for robotics and a drive to contribute to the advancement of the field.




What Sets This Role Apart:

Competitive salary
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects at the intersection of AI and robotics.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Collaborative and inclusive work culture with a diverse team.
Your chance to join a growing company serving amazing customers.
4-Day Work Week: We value quality over quantity. Enjoy a three-day weekend, every week.
Warrant Program: Share in our success. Our attractive warrant program ensures that as we grow, you benefit.




Why Join Robotto? Here, we don't just offer jobs; we offer opportunities to be part of a movement. A movement that believes in the infinite possibilities of human and machine collaboration. If you're someone who sees the bigger picture, who wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization, Robotto is where you belong.




How to Apply: At Robotto, we are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is evaluated based on their skills and potential. To ensure fairness and neutrality in our selection process, please refrain from including your name or any images on your resume and cover letter. We are agnostic to gender and background, and we want to focus solely on your qualifications and passion. If our vision resonates with you and you believe you can contribute to our journey, we'd love to hear from you. Send your anonymized resume, cover letter, and a brief note on "Why Robotto?" to Christine Thaagaard at Career@robotto.ai. Christine will forward your application to the relevant team for review




If you are an expert in Ardupilot, Gazebo, MAVLink, with a strong background in control theory, signal processing, and proficiency in deploying software onto robotics platforms, apply now to join us at Robotto and make a significant impact in the field of robotics!

Show more

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


Skills: javascript,aws,angular,python,aws/gcp,sql,nestjs,typescript,gcp,nest.js,full stack development,react

Title: Full Stack Developer for Green Tech Solutions
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in shaping the future of biodiversity and environmental sustainability.




Are you passionate about building innovative technology to make a positive environmental impact? Do you have solid experience working with PHP and Laravel, and a structured approach to development? If so, FaunaPhotonics is looking for a Full Stack Developer like you to help us continuously improve and innovate our customer portal. 

 

 

About FaunaPhotonics 

At FaunaPhotonics, we are at the forefront of insect monitoring, providing essential data to support biodiversity preservation. Our IoT sensor technologies capture insect activity, which is processed and analyzed in our Data Lake using AI. The resulting biodiversity insights are presented to our customers through our customer portal, enabling them to take informed action and document their impact on biodiversity. In doing so, we help drive sustainable solutions for the planet. 

 

We’re a team of approximately 15 professionals working out of our office in Nordhavn. Our work environment embraces agile development, cross-functional collaboration, and a culture of innovation. We prioritize open dialogue, fail-fast experimentation, and an entrepreneurial mindset as we pursue our shared vision. 

 

Your Role 

We launched our new customer portal in April, built with PHP and Laravel and hosted on AWS. It integrates with our IoT sensor technologies, offering near-time insights into ecosystem health. Now, we are focused on improving the portal based on customer feedback and simplifying the way we present eco-system health data. 

 

As a Full Stack Developer, you will be an integral part of this process. You will help refine existing features, develop new functionalities, and drive innovation in the user experience. 

 

Key Responsibilities 

Enhance and improve our customer portal by leveraging customer feedback. 
Build intuitive, user-friendly interfaces for presenting complex biodiversity and insect activity data. 
Work closely with our team to integrate new technologies and maintain a scalable infrastructure on AWS. 
Collaborate in an agile environment with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation. 

 

What We're Looking For 

5 years of experience with PHP, preferably Laravel. 
DevOps experience, cloud infrastructure, and deployment on AWS. 
Frontend experience building interfaces with ReactJS. 
A structured individual who can work methodically, focusing on scalability and maintainability. 
Proven experience building and maintaining web applications. 
An ability to innovate and simplify the presentation of data in customer-facing environments. 
A passion for environmental sustainability and creating impactful technology. 
Familiarity with agile development and cross-functional collaboration. 

 

Why FaunaPhotonics? 

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a company where technology meets environmental impact. You will contribute directly to a product that aids in tracking biodiversity and fostering a sustainable future. 

 

Interested? 

We invite you to reach out to us with your vision and technical approach. Share how you would tackle this challenge and contribute to FaunaPhotonics’ mission. 

We’re not looking for a typical CV submission process—we’d love to converse beyond the traditional interview format. We're excited to hear your ideas and explore how you might fit into our team. 

 

Contact 

For more information, connect with Niels Krebs, Chief Technology Officer, at NIKR@faunaphotonics.com or call +45 22 69 74 61 

 

Note to recruiters and consultancies: We are handling this recruitment entirely in-house, and we are not interested in external proposals or pitches at this time. 

 

Show more

Title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for our next Senior Site Reliability Engineer to join our SRE team which is located in a group of teams called, the Developer Platform Group, consisting of Security, Developer Experience, SRE, and Backend Core. You’ll work closely with these teams and cross-team collaboration is encouraged. This gives you a wonderful opportunity to continue to grow in your role and both widen and deepen your skills.

In this role, you will work with our core infrastructure, everything from how our cloud providers (AWS and GCP) are configured through Terraform to how our microservices are deployed to Kubernetes and being monitored. You can see a more detailed list below of the things we work with, we believe that you have worked in some of them and that you’ll quickly learn the rest on the job. Working with all these tools and the wide scope of the team can be daunting, but you will work in a large SRE team where teamwork is highly encouraged.

Working At Pleo

Working at Pleo means that you get to work together with hundreds of people from different backgrounds and geographies. It also means that you will get to work on challenging projects, stemming from the fact that we are a scale-up in the fintech industry and that we want to provide the best possible experience for our customers while they are dealing with their expenses.

Joining our team, you'll find that our projects can be as complex and dynamic as a Kubernetes cluster, but don't worry—every team member is like a pod, uniquely skilled, and perfectly orchestrated. And just like Kubernetes ensures no container goes unmonitored, our team camps make sure no team member goes un-caffeinated! You’ll meet up for a few days in one of our many offices and spend valuable time together as a team working on whatever you think is most important to you and your team!

Skills And Experience We Are Looking For


Datadog or any other observability stack
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Terraform
Kubernetes
Flux / GitOps
Most major AWS services
Istio
GitHub Actions
Go


Your colleagues would say you


Work in English with ease (it's our company language)
Never stop being curious and love learning about new languages/ frameworks/ working styles
Have experience solving complex technical challenges at scale
Ensure a high bar for quality and reliability within your team
Coach others to help them develop as engineers
Advocate for a more thorough code review process than a quick scroll to the bottom of the page and a “LGTM!”
You don’t just write code; you help to design the overall solution
Are sought after within your team for help in solving challenging problems
You’re a force multiplier within your team - your work enables other engineers to do even better
Able to raise and describe technical debt faced by your team. And then able to propose a solution or path forward


Show Me The Benefits


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen, and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶
All of us have a stake in Pleo’s success - ask us about our equity grant scheme


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Analytical Research Scientist for Core Biochemical Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark : Hoersholm

Country: Denmark

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist!

For Core Biochemical Analytics, we are looking for a curious and versatile analytical scientist with preferably 3 – 5 years of work experience who will be part of our sugar analysis platform.

At Novonesis, you contribute every single day to a more sustainable future based on biological solutions. We develop and produce, among other things, bacterial cultures for yogurt and cheese, probiotics for food supplements, and new microbiological solutions to extend the shelf life of products.

Core Biochemical Analytics is part of the R&D organization in Novonesis. Our analysis work is carried out in collaboration with various business areas such as Dairy, Plant Health, Animal Health, Enzymes and Human Health.

Welcome to Core Biochemical Analytics...

Core Biochemical Analytics develops chemical and biochemical analysis methods and provides quantitative as well as qualitative data of sugars and volatile components in food and other products. We use gas, liquid, and ion chromatography in combination with various detectors. Robots are a natural part of the workflows, and we always pay attention to automation and digitalization options for our pipelines.

Core Biochemical Analytics is a multinational department where we emphasize good collaboration, there is room for all of us, and where we help each other. We value the good communication between researchers, laboratory technicians and students, and we work closely together to solve our tasks.

The department consists of two specialized technology platforms targeting volatiles and carbohydrates incl. small organic acids. You will be associated with the carbohydrate’s platform.

In this role you’ll make an impact by…

Delivering high-quality research data for product development and understanding. Your role as analytical chemist will be to support a team of technicians in their daily operation of our IC and LC platforms used for quantification of sugars, larger carbohydrates, and organic acids, including working hands-on in the laboratory. Additionally, you will contribute with chemical understanding of carbohydrates in food, fermentation, and a solid understanding of their analysis.

Your daily work will be centered around interaction with technicians and delivering robust results from high-throughput analytical pipelines. Automation and digitalization are key for us, and our analytical pipelines rely on robots (Hamilton) and digital integration with different software solutions such as Chromeleon, Benchling, and Sample Manager.

Your Tasks Will Include


Securing robust analytical pipelines and workflows, including qualification, instrument maintenance, and quality assurance
Developing new methods and pipelines
Participating in routine sample analysis of carbohydrates and small organic acids with quantitative methods (IC-PAD and LC-MS/MS)
Coordinating with internal stakeholders on projects and samples
Ensuring best experimental/analytical praxis with focus on digitalization and automation


We are looking for…

A scientist with practical experience and preferably a PhD. You could have worked a few years with analytical chemistry or biochemistry, preferably hands-on with instrument troubleshooting, method development, and quantitative chromatography.

You are good at communicating with colleagues in the laboratory as well as with partners outside the team. You are a good team player and you thrive in a dynamic environment with a strong focus on high-throughput methods. You are motivated by providing robust data for product development and research. It is an advantage to have some experience with microbiology and/or food chemistry.

Further, You Preferably Have


Hands-on ion chromatography and HPLC experience using MS/MS, RI and/or UV detectors
An interest in digitalization opportunities, and experience with LIMS systems
Experience in sample purification of complex matrices
Knowledge of Chromeleon, Benchling, Sample Manager, Python, SASJMP
Fluency in both spoken and written English


We do not expect you to have all of the above skills, but we look forward to hearing from you if you have experience with some of the above mentioned.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: October 1st, 2024. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Department Manager, Lars Holm Rasmussen, DKLARA@chr-hansen.com +45 2016 9734.

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Location: Denmark : Hoersholm

Country: Denmark

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist!

For Core Biochemical Analytics, we are looking for a curious and versatile analytical scientist with preferably 3 – 5 years of work experience who will be part of our sugar analysis platform.

At Novonesis, you contribute every single day to a more sustainable future based on biological solutions. We develop and produce, among other things, bacterial cultures for yogurt and cheese, probiotics for food supplements, and new microbiological solutions to extend the shelf life of products.

Core Biochemical Analytics is part of the R&D organization in Novonesis. Our analysis work is carried out in collaboration with various business areas such as Dairy, Plant Health, Animal Health, Enzymes and Human Health.

Welcome to Core Biochemical Analytics...

Core Biochemical Analytics develops chemical and biochemical analysis methods and provides quantitative as well as qualitative data of sugars and volatile components in food and other products. We use gas, liquid, and ion chromatography in combination with various detectors. Robots are a natural part of the workflows, and we always pay attention to automation and digitalization options for our pipelines.

Core Biochemical Analytics is a multinational department where we emphasize good collaboration, there is room for all of us, and where we help each other. We value the good communication between researchers, laboratory technicians and students, and we work closely together to solve our tasks.

The department consists of two specialized technology platforms targeting volatiles and carbohydrates incl. small organic acids. You will be associated with the carbohydrate’s platform.

Delivering high-quality research data for product development and understanding. Your role as analytical chemist will be to support a team of technicians in their daily operation of our IC and LC platforms used for quantification of sugars, larger carbohydrates, and organic acids, including working hands-on in the laboratory. Additionally, you will contribute with chemical understanding of carbohydrates in food, fermentation, and a solid understanding of their analysis.

Your daily work will be centered around interaction with technicians and delivering robust results from high-throughput analytical pipelines. Automation and digitalization are key for us, and our analytical pipelines rely on robots (Hamilton) and digital integration with different software solutions such as Chromeleon, Benchling, and Sample Manager.

Your Tasks Will Include

  • Securing robust analytical pipelines and workflows, including qualification, instrument maintenance, and quality assurance
  • Developing new methods and pipelines
  • Participating in routine sample analysis of carbohydrates and small organic acids with quantitative methods (IC-PAD and LC-MS/MS)
  • Coordinating with internal stakeholders on projects and samples
  • Ensuring best experimental/analytical praxis with focus on digitalization and automation

We are looking for…

A scientist with practical experience and preferably a PhD. You could have worked a few years with analytical chemistry or biochemistry, preferably hands-on with instrument troubleshooting, method development, and quantitative chromatography.

You are good at communicating with colleagues in the laboratory as well as with partners outside the team. You are a good team player and you thrive in a dynamic environment with a strong focus on high-throughput methods. You are motivated by providing robust data for product development and research. It is an advantage to have some experience with microbiology and/or food chemistry.

Further, You Preferably Have

  • Hands-on ion chromatography and HPLC experience using MS/MS, RI and/or UV detectors
  • An interest in digitalization opportunities, and experience with LIMS systems
  • Experience in sample purification of complex matrices
  • Knowledge of Chromeleon, Benchling, Sample Manager, Python, SASJMP
  • Fluency in both spoken and written English

We do not expect you to have all of the above skills, but we look forward to hearing from you if you have experience with some of the above mentioned.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: October 1st, 2024. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Solutions Engineer - North Europe
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

CyberArk, is looking for a Solutions Engineer for Presales, covering the North Europe

In this role, you will combine technical knowledge with sales skills and are ultimately responsible for the technical win during the sales cycle. You are responsible for actively driving and managing the technology evaluation stage of the sales process which will require you to work with multiple stakeholders. You will match the customers/prospects business requirements to how the CyberArk Identity Security Platform can assist from a technical perspective. Therefore, you must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. You must be able to identify all technical issues to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

Above all, we are looking for someone that can communicate the CyberArk value and be able to design an optimal solution for complex customer infrastructure and datacenter environments on a global scale.

To be successful, you must be comfortable in a dynamic atmosphere of a technical organization with a rapidly expanding customer base, possess strong communication and interpersonal skills as you will be required to build relationships across multiple levels of the organizations. Being organized, analytical & having the ability to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches is also essential.

Responsibilities:



Provide technical pre-sales hands-on support.
Collaborate with Account Executives throughout the entire sales process.
Effectively present CyberArk’s technical value proposition to customers and partners.
Ensure the success of customer proof-of-concepts (POCs).
Respond to the functional and technical aspects of RFIs/RFPs.
Proactively seek new sales opportunities by developing technical relationships with prospective accounts.
Document client feature requests and issues in CyberArk internal systems.
Support CyberArk seminars and industry trade shows in the region.
Communicate customer requirements to Product Management teams.
Develop technical knowledge and skills of CyberArk solutions and related technologies.
Travel within the region (25%-50%). 



Qualifications



3+ years of experience as a Solutions Engineer and/or Professional Services Engineer, or equivalent experience.
High-level understanding of security concepts and the development of security roles within organizations that meet functional, technical, and regulatory requirements.
Strong hands-on technical abilities.
Hands-on experience with Windows Administration, Active Directory and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge in the leading cloud service providers: AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Understand complex customer environments and design optimal architectural solutions for them.
Fluent Danish and English language skills essential
What could set you apart as a top candidate:
Prior experience with CyberArk Identity Security solutions.
Experience in Privilege Access Management (PAM), Identity and Access Management (IAM), or Identity Management (IDM) solutions.
Knowledge and understanding of containerized environments and CI/CD toolchains.
Show more

Title: Fullstack Software Engineer I (TnT)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

We are growing our engineering teams at Trustpilot and are looking to welcome onboard Fullstack Software Engineers. Our SWE I vacancies sit within our Trust & Transparency (TnT) team!

You will join a cross-functional team with full ownership of our products and codebase, where you will take part in every step of the development process, from ideation to maintenance. A place where you can grow as an individual, while also having an influence (or even guide) the direction of projects and technological choices.

Trust And Transparency Team

The Trust and Transparency teams are focus on upholding the core values of Trustpilot by building and maintaining user Trust. Across the three Trust teams we leverage AI and Machine Learning, process high volume data to combat fake reviews, promote trustworthy content, streamline and automate processes providing a consistent and credible user experience, and ensure all parties involved with Trustpilot are operating fairly in accordance with our terms of use. At Trustpilot, the environment encourages innovation and every engineer has a substantial influence on the service quality and user experience we're recognized for.

What You’ll Be Doing


Efficiently oversee assigned projects and tasks
Work in a cross-functional “full ownership” team alongside Product, Design, and Data Science where you will take part in every step of the process of building, from ideation and design to architecture, code, deployment, and maintenance
Take part in decision-making and design discussions during the development
Assist in planning, implementing, and releasing new features
Troubleshoot existing software, squashing those nasty little bugs
Inspire and challenge the organization with your knowledge of how to solve problems
Analyse, gather, and aggregate data to support decisions, both technical and non-technical


Who You Are


Experience in full-stack web development (extra point if also in a cross-functional team)
Experience developing RESTful APIs (ideally high volume) and distributed cloud services
Experience with component-based front-end development (ideally React, but we know you can learn quickly)
Although Cloud experience isn’t required for this role, we be excited to hear if you have hands-on experience
A cooperative nature, keen on engaging in open dialogue and mutual exchange of constructive feedback
With a zealous and determined attitude toward your tasks, you encourage everyone to pursue ongoing enhancement in a constructive manner


Some Relevant Technologies And Services We Use


Infrastructure: AWS (ECS, Lambda, SNS, SQS, CloudFormation ...), Docker
Languages: Typescript, Javascript
Frontend: React, Next.js, CSS Modules, SASS, Styled Components
Database: DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, BigQuery


Find more on: https://stackshare.io/trustpilot

What's In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

We offer flexibility and are offering these roles to work hybrid with a mixture of office and remote working, or if you are looking to be fully remote we are open to discussing this too! (As long as you are based in the UK or Denmark)

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.
Show more

Title: MBT Developers - Denmark
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Belmont Lavan Ltd is actively seeking talented MBT (Model-Based Testing) Developers to become part of our innovative team in Denmark. If you're passionate about software testing and have experience with model-based methodologies, we want you!

Responsibilities:


Design and develop advanced model-based testing frameworks
Engage with stakeholders to analyze system requirements and create effective testing models
Implement automated test cases derived from models to ensure comprehensive software coverage
Monitor testing results, identify defects, and liaise with development teams for swift resolution
Enhance testing methodologies to elevate software quality and efficiency
Maintain accurate documentation of testing processes and results



Requirements

Required Skills and Experience:


Strong background in software development or quality assurance with a focus on model-based testing
Proficient in the use of MBT tools and frameworks
Experience with programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#
Solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Attention to detail and a drive for high-quality outcomes
Strong communication and collaboration skills



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with performance testing or load testing tools
Knowledge of additional testing frameworks and methodologies
Industry-related experience is a bonus



Assignment Duration: Initially a 6-month contract with the possibility of extension.

Location: Denmark, with flexible options for remote work.

Required skills: Python, Java, Kubernetes, Kafka

Preferred skills: FX

Languages: English

Title: Lead AI Test Automation Engineer 10 Months Contract
Description:
we are looking for Lead AI Test Automation Engineer 🔹

We are looking for a Lead AI Test Automation Engineer who is excited about building quality AI solutions and energized about making a large impact for users and ultimately the patients of Novo Nordisk. Our applications bring cutting-edge AI innovation to thousands of scientists, data scientists, ML engineers, and users in the line of business. Our ambition is to deliver the best AI solutions tailored to Novo Nordisk, using our modern and integrated development process.

✔️Your main responsibilities include:


Create and own the test strategy for the software product
Write and maintain automated tests for various software components
Collaborate with development teams to ensure software meets quality standards
Communicate with stakeholders, including product managers, to understand requirements and ensure test coverage
Stay up to date with the latest testing tools and technologies
Integrate testing activities throughout the entire product life cycle
Utilize frameworks for UI testing



✔️We are looking for:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a similar area
7+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on automated testing
Strong knowledge of test automation frameworks and tools (UI)
Experience with test-driven development and continuous integration
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Typescript, or JavaScript
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
Understanding of software development principles and methodologies
Professional collaborative software engineering experience with Git, peer reviews
Proficiency in cloud platforms Azure and/or AWS



✔️ Nice to have:


Data integration knowledge is a plus
User research or UX experience is a plus
Basic knowledge of AI is a plus



Requirements

Required skills

Azure

Typescipt

Javascript

Python

CI/CD

Languages

English

  • Stay up to date with the latest testing tools and technologies
  • Integrate testing activities throughout the entire product life cycle
  • Utilize frameworks for UI testing


✔️We are looking for:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a similar area
  • 7+ years of experience in software testing, with a focus on automated testing
  • Strong knowledge of test automation frameworks and tools (UI)
  • Experience with test-driven development and continuous integration
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Typescript, or JavaScript
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines
  • Ability to write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
  • Understanding of software development principles and methodologies
  • Professional collaborative software engineering experience with Git, peer reviews
  • Proficiency in cloud platforms Azure and/or AWS


✔️ Nice to have:

  • Data integration knowledge is a plus
  • User research or UX experience is a plus
  • Basic knowledge of AI is a plus

Title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Gen AI
Description:
Why Mozilla?

Mozilla Corporation is the non-profit-backed technology company that has shaped the internet for the better over the last 25 years. We make pioneering brands like Firefox, the privacy-minded web browser, and Pocket, a service for keeping up with the best content online. Now, with more than 225 million people around the world using our products each month, we’re shaping the next 25 years of technology and helping to reclaim an internet built for people, not companies. Our work focuses on diverse areas including AI, social media, security and more. And we’re doing this while never losing our focus on our core mission – to make the internet better for people.

The Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the non-profit 501(c) Mozilla Foundation. This means we aren’t beholden to any shareholders — only to our mission. Along with thousands of volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozillians design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms.

About This Team And Role

The Firefox team is a community of engineers who care deeply about delivering the fastest, friendliest, most usable browser possible. We are responsible for making the things you see in the browser work securely, quickly, and well! We are looking for a Staff Machine Learning Engineer to help us develop and grow new Generative AI driven products and tools. You will play a key role in enabling safe and healthy machine learning and Generative AI driven experiences in Firefox.

What is a Staff Engineer at Mozilla?

A Staff Engineer is the next level from a Senior Engineer. At Mozilla this role can vary but typically a Staff Engineer is a domain expert who leads others within a single team to tackle multi-month projects. Tasks that may be initially ambiguous or require significant planning and require them to influence or direct the work of several engineers. They sequence deliverables and manage risks in their team's projects, provide feedback on our strategy and goals affecting the team, and turn our strategy into action for their team members. Staff Engineers mentor others by stewarding some responsibilities to more junior and senior engineers so they can take on new ones. They collaborate with management on building team consensus and providing direction. Staff Engineers identify gaps and opportunities for improvement to enable a culture of inclusion and allyship, at all levels of the organization.

What You’ll Do


Lead the design, development, and integration of Generative AI solutions in Firefox, collaborating cross functionally with product management, full stack engineering and design.
Build infrastructure for training and inference of LLMs and small language and vision models for use cases on the web and mobile Firefox product experiences.
Implement robust validation and testing procedures to ensure the developed models' generalizability and reliability
Continuously monitor and optimize deployed models for performance and efficiency


What You'll Bring


6+ years experience as a Machine Learning engineer building tooling and services for machine learning applications in production.
Experience with designing and building machine learning tooling and infrastructure for training, deploying, inference and validation of models.
Experience with distributed systems and platforms for AI integrations across a breadth of applications such as LLM APIs, Cloud based and open source tooling.
Leading architecture designs to execution independently and track record of improving the team’s overall AI development velocity.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working collaboratively with product managers, project managers, and/or other non-engineering teams.
Effective documentation and communication skills on a distributed team.
Commitment to our values:
Welcoming differences
Being relationship-minded
Practicing responsible participation
Having grit

Bonus Points


Knowledge of and experience with using LLM solutions across different cloud providers
You have previously successfully contributed to an open source project.
Track record of not only building one, but multiple projects deployed with an active user base.
Experience with responsible AI, transparent algorithms, and putting users’ needs first.
Excellent communication skills, both in written and presentation form. You have the ability to quickly distill sophisticated topics into concepts that are tailored for your target audience.
You are a lifelong learner, and continue to refine and improve your skills when you see an opportunity to do so.
Experience with the browser extensions architecture or ecosystem.
Experience working in open source environments.


What You’ll Get


Generous performance-based bonus plans to all eligible employees - we share in our success as one team
Rich medical, dental, and vision coverage
Generous retirement contributions with 100% immediate vesting (regardless of whether you contribute)
Quarterly all-company wellness days where everyone takes a pause together
Country specific holidays plus a day off for your birthday
One-time home office stipend
Annual professional development budget
Quarterly well-being stipend
Considerable paid parental leave
Employee referral bonus program
Other benefits (life/AD&D, disability, EAP, etc. - varies by country)


About Mozilla

Mozilla exists to build the Internet as a public resource accessible to all because we believe that open and free is better than closed and controlled. When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of Web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the Web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.

Commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging

Mozilla understands that valuing diverse creative practices and forms of knowledge are crucial to and enrich the company’s core mission. We encourage applications from everyone, including members of all equity-seeking communities, such as (but certainly not limited to) women, racialized and Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of all sexual orientations, gender identities, and expressions.

We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, as appropriate. Please contact us at hiringaccommodation@mozilla.com to request accommodation.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race (including hairstyle and texture), religion (including religious grooming and dress practices), gender, gender identity, gender expression, color, national origin, pregnancy, ancestry, domestic partner status, disability, sexual orientation, age, genetic predisposition, medical condition, marital status, citizenship status, military or veteran status, or any other basis covered by applicable laws. Mozilla will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics or any other unlawful behavior, conduct, or purpose.

Title: Data Scientist studentermedhjælper til Dansk Reklame Films Analyseafdeling
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Som Data Scientist studentermedhjælper i Dansk Reklame Films analyseteam, kommer du til at operere i en salgsorganisation, hvor analysearbejdet sættes i relation til annoncesalg, marketing og forretning. Dine primære opgaver vil være at understøtte Dansk Reklame Films Client Managers i salgsarbejdet, samt give beslutningsstøtte til Finance og ledelse ved at behandle, analysere, visualisere og tilgængeliggøre forretningsdata.




DRF Research

Vi tilbyder et udviklende og fagligt relevant job i en ambitiøs, fremgangsrig og dynamisk organisation, hvor dagligdagen er præget af forandringer og afvekslende opgaver. Dit nye arbejdssted bliver Nordisk Films helt særlige miljø i Valby, der opleves som en lille by i byen. Du bliver en del af vores ambitiøse analyseteam bestående af otte engagerede kollegaer. Vi er generelt kendetegnet ved højt humør og en direkte omgangstone. Derudover går vi meget op i vores professionalisme, hvilket for os betyder, at det produkt og den service vi leverer, er i orden. Som team løfter vi i flok, og vi er alle orienterede mod et fælles mål - at udvikle Dansk Reklame Films position på mediemarkedet.




Stillingen

Arbejdstiden vil være 15-20 timer om ugen med høj fleksibilitet særligt omkring eksamensperioder. Som studentermedhjælper, vil du i samarbejde med virksomhedens medarbejdere inden for analyse, marketing, økonomi og salg bidrage til det daglige arbejde med at indsamle, strukturere, analysere og præsentere data, analyser og indsigter. Vi kan tilbyde en udfordrende og studierelevant stilling med mulighed for yderligere at udvikle dine kompetencer, og du vil, udover dine kolleger i analyseafdelingen, komme til at arbejde sammen med et team af BI-specialister i Nordisk Film.




Arbejdsområdet spænder bredt inden for bl.a. BI, databehandling, inventory management, markedsanalyse og salgsopbakkende analysearbejde, og dine opgaver bliver bl.a. at:




Udarbejde analyser og rapporter
Automatisere databehandling og analysearbejde
Vedligeholde og opdatere virksomhedens datavarehus i SQL
Optimere varelager, forecast og priser
Udvikle dashboards og generelt bidrage til datavisualisering




Herudover vil arbejdsdagen bestå af diverse ad hoc-opgaver, samt support til de øvrige analysekonsulenter i afdelingen i forbindelse med det generelle analysearbejde.




Hvem søger vi?

Vi forestiller os, at du er studerende på en relevant bachelor- eller kandidatuddannelse, f.eks. BSc i Data Science, MSc i Digital Innovation & Management, BSc i Business Administration and Digital Management, MSc i Business Administration and Information Systems - Data Science, HA(mat.), Cand.merc.(mat) eller lignende fra f.eks. ITU, KU eller CBS.




Du er selvstændig, proaktiv og initiativrig, tænker ud af boksen og har gode samarbejdsevner. Du skal være ambitiøs, både når det gælder dig selv, men også i jagten på at bidrage til analyseafdelingens produktudvikling og Dansk Reklame Films forretning som helhed.




Vi vægter, at du:




Er analytisk stærk, struktureret og systematisk
Har interesse for at udvikle dine kompetencer indenfor datavisualisering, datamodellering og det at fortælle historier med data
Har lyst til at løse innovationskrævende opgaver og arbejde proaktivt på egen hånd
Har stor interesse i biografmediet, mediemarkedet i sin helhed og Dansk Reklame Films forretning i særdeleshed




Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med BI-værktøjer som Tableau, Power BI eller Qlik Sense (vi arbejder i Qlik Sense), samt kendskab til SQL og python/R.




Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte: Asbjørn Shee Crusell, 50 92 59 81 eller asb@drf.dk.




Ansøgningsfristen er 07/10/2024, og vi afholder interviews løbende. Vi forbeholder os retten til at fjerne annoncen, når den rette kandidat er fundet. Ansøgninger sendt via e-mail vil ikke blive betragtet.




Arbejdsadresse:

Mosedalvej 14

Valby, DK, 2500

Denmark




Om Dansk Reklame Film

Vi skal være det foretrukne branding- og imagemedie i Danmark, og med ekstraordinære medarbejdere, skal vi skabe den ekstraordinære reklameoplevelse – for brugere, annoncører og samarbejdspartnere. Dette gør vi med udgangspunkt i biografmediet, hvor vores primære produkt er salg og distribution af biografreklame i Danmark gennem vores landsdækkende netværk af partnerbiografer.




Vores værdier:




Holdånd – vi gør det sammen!
Engagement – man kan mærke os!
Professionalisme – det skal være i orden!




Nordisk Film er den førende producent og distributør af indhold i de nordiske lande og driver biografer i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. Vores digitale forretninger omfatter GoGift, og vi investerer endvidere i virksomheder inden for elektronisk spiludvikling. Desuden markedsfører vi PlayStation i de nordiske og baltiske lande. Vi er en del af Egmont. Egmont er en fond, hvilket betyder, at vores overskud geninvesteres i virksomhederne, og hvert år går mere end 13 mio. EUR til velgørende formål, der forbedrer børns liv og støtter filmtalenter.




We bring stories to life.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse cloud-løsninger? Hybrid Professionals søger både erfarne og nyuddannede til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.




Vi er et dansk konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Microsoft Dynamics 365 og Salesforce. Vi er på forkant med teknologierne og har flere konsulenter som er certificeret i Azure, Salesforce og Dynamics 365 teknologier. 




Hvilken rolle får du?

Du vil blive en del af et team, der rådgiver, designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger. Vi udvikler komplekse løsninger og har løbende release frekvenser i vores projekter, og som nyansat kan du forvente at se din indflydelse i projektet allerede den første uge du er ansat.




Hvad kommer du til at arbejde med

Microsoft Azure teknologi stack.
C# og .NET
JavaScript++
REST API’er
Mulesoft og Power Apps
Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE: Sales, Service og Marketing
Salesforce Sales Cloud + Service Cloud
Marketing Automation med ClickDimensions
Marketing Automation med Pardot eller Marketing Cloud
Git, Automatiseret build + test + release




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Nyuddannet:

Relevant uddannelse i softwareudvikling
Erfaring med C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog
Du vil gerne indgå i et projektteam, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet.




Kandidater med mere erfaring:

Relevant uddannelse i softwareudvikling
Vi forventer, at du er erfaren i C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog
Du har flere års erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
Du vil gerne indgå i et projektteam, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Microsoft Azure, .NET Core og Salesforce




Du taler og skriver flydende dansk, og taler og skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.




Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver, trives med at løfte i flok og være en del af et team. 




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Du kan se frem til at udfolde dine evner i lækre lokaler i hjertet af København lige ved rådhuspladsen og kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver dig en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige videreudvikling alvorligt.




Vi lægger også meget vægt på personlig og faglig udvikling. Du får tildelt en mentor, bliver certificeret i relevante platforme, og du kan deltage i relevante teknologiseminar. 




Som ansat i Hybrid Professionals kan du glæde dig til

stærk faglighed og gode udviklingsmuligheder
god balance mellem arbejde og fritid samt et godt arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi vil hinanden
attraktive løn- og ansættelsesvilkår
mulighed for hjemmearbejde og fleksibilitet
Fri fridage mellem jul og nytår
et spændende miljø med et solidt sammenhold med jævnlige sociale og faglige arrangementer
at være en del af en stærk organisation i udvikling og vækst
Show more
HTML:
Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse cloud-løsninger? Hybrid Professionals søger både erfarne og nyuddannede til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.


Vi er et dansk konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Microsoft Dynamics 365 og Salesforce. Vi er på forkant med teknologierne og har flere konsulenter som er certificeret i Azure, Salesforce og Dynamics 365 teknologier. 


Hvilken rolle får du?

Du vil blive en del af et team, der rådgiver, designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger. Vi udvikler komplekse løsninger og har løbende release frekvenser i vores projekter, og som nyansat kan du forvente at se din indflydelse i projektet allerede den første uge du er ansat.


Hvad kommer du til at arbejde med

  • Microsoft Azure teknologi stack.
  • C# og .NET
  • JavaScript++
  • REST API’er
  • Mulesoft og Power Apps
  • Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE: Sales, Service og Marketing
  • Salesforce Sales Cloud + Service Cloud
  • Marketing Automation med ClickDimensions
  • Marketing Automation med Pardot eller Marketing Cloud
  • Git, Automatiseret build + test + release


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


Nyuddannet:

  • Relevant uddannelse i softwareudvikling
  • Erfaring med C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et projektteam, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet.

  • Vi forventer, at du er erfaren i C# eller lignende objektorienteret sprog
  • Du har flere års erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et projektteam, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Microsoft Azure, .NET Core og Salesforce


Du taler og skriver flydende dansk, og taler og skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.


Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver, trives med at løfte i flok og være en del af et team. 


Hvad tilbyder vi?

Du kan se frem til at udfolde dine evner i lækre lokaler i hjertet af København lige ved rådhuspladsen og kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver dig en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige videreudvikling alvorligt.


Vi lægger også meget vægt på personlig og faglig udvikling. Du får tildelt en mentor, bliver certificeret i relevante platforme, og du kan deltage i relevante teknologiseminar. 


Som ansat i Hybrid Professionals kan du glæde dig til

  • stærk faglighed og gode udviklingsmuligheder
  • god balance mellem arbejde og fritid samt et godt arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi vil hinanden
  • attraktive løn- og ansættelsesvilkår
  • mulighed for hjemmearbejde og fleksibilitet
  • Fri fridage mellem jul og nytår
  • et spændende miljø med et solidt sammenhold med jævnlige sociale og faglige arrangementer
  • at være en del af en stærk organisation i udvikling og vækst

Title: System Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
On behalf of groupe.one, we are searching for a Compute and Storage Systems Engineer.




Do you want to be part of one of the largest Linux/Open source environments in Scandinavia, working alongside 45 passionate engineering co-workers?




We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Systems Engineer to take on the challenge of building and maintaining the infrastructure that enables group.one to efficiently manage thousands of servers.




You will have the chance to join this inspiring global organization and be part of an exciting journey with a company that is growing internationally and cares deeply about its employees.

Since its founding in 2002, group.one has continuously evolved and is today one of the leading companies in Europe within domain and web hosting. They offer an international environment focused on flexibility. It is important to them that you feel they are offering you a workplace you’ll never want to leave.




Your role:

Be an integral part of the team developing and maintaining the hardware deployment automation and storage systems.
Contribute to the design and maintenance of the internal Ubuntu Linux server setup.
Work with Linux-based open-source software solutions, focusing on creating Infrastructure-as-Code solutions.
Architect and develop infrastructure setups that support the next steps in our growth.
Develop infrastructure to provide high-performance and highly available services for millions of daily users.
Ensure that anything repetitive is automated.




Your skills:

Strong Linux expertise.
A solid understanding of file systems.
Experience with adapting the Linux kernel.
Experience with automated deployment of Linux on servers.
Proficiency in one or more programming languages, such as Python, C, Golang, or Rust.
Experience with Chef or other configuration management tools (Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc.) is an advantage.
Thrive in a DevOps role where you have end-to-end responsibility for writing, deploying, and maintaining code.
A strong bias toward automating anything repetitive.




How they work: group.one believes in teamwork at every level—solutions improve when working together. They openly discuss ideas and review each other's code. At group.one, you'll work with some of the brightest minds and experience a great team spirit. Be prepared to learn a lot when you join—they promise it will be both challenging and fun.

They have built most of their processes around technical solutions rather than paperwork and manuals, allowing them to move quickly, accelerated and supported by technology.




Become a part of group.one: group.one manages more than 4,100,000 domains across 150 countries and employs over 1,400 people. A strong team spirit and ambitious goals unite the entire organization. You can expect an international culture, great diversity, and English as the corporate language.




group.one offers you:

A modern office environment at one of the best locations in Copenhagen, Kalvebod Brygge.
Flexible work and “work from home” options, with the potential to almost work fully remote after an onboarding period. Most choose to come to the office weekly.
Several social and professional events.
Your choice of a Mac or Lenovo laptop with Linux as your daily work tool.
A free website with a domain and hosting.
Health insurance.
A varied and delicious lunch arrangement.




For more information, please contact Katarina Merle Rasmussen at +45 22221015 or send us an email at job@coresearch.dk.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer, Impact
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about creating data solutions that are scalable and provide data-driven insights? If you're interested in joining a dedicated and collaborative team that specializes in data collection, visualization, and reporting to help world-class researchers understand the impact of their work, you might be the Data Engineer we're looking for in our Data Department!

Our Data Department is part of the Novo Nordisk Foundation's Impact Area. The department aims to deliver high-quality data and advanced data-based solutions that align with the Foundation's strategy and key objectives. The goal is to create impact across the entire value chain of the Foundation. The responsibility of the Impact Area is to evaluate the impact of the Foundation's initiatives and monitor our progress toward strategic targets.

The Impact Area comprises 15 highly skilled and passionate colleagues, including seven members in the Data Department. As a team, we are committed to excellence in our work, leveraging strong professional expertise, dedication, and a passion for making a difference in our respective fields, all while enjoying teamwork and camaraderie.

The Job

As a Data Engineer, you'll develop solutions and construct data pipelines to assess Novo Nordisk Foundation's grant impacts across various sectors. Collaborating with the Data Department and Impact Area, you'll handle data processing and analysis. You'll also lead projects creating Business Intelligence (BI) solutions for key stakeholders.

Your tasks will include:


Setting up systems and processes for cleaning data using tools of your choice to ensure high data quality and integrity through audits and validation processes
Extracting data via advanced queries from multiple databases and ensuring seamless system-to-system integration
Designing and implementing dimensional models to support data warehousing and reporting needs
Creating and maintaining semantic models for the BI solutions
Build and maintain data pipelines, primarily using Databricks, PySpark, SQL, and Python to deliver clean, well-structured data for consumption by data scientists and analysts, ensuring readiness for machine learning and statistical analysis, while leveraging relevant Azure tools
Staying updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data engineering and analytics



Professional And Personal Qualifications

Our ideal candidate holds an M.Sc. and/or Ph.D. in (Social) Data Science or has equivalent experience with documented training. We are looking for someone with at least 5 years of experience in data management or data engineering. You should have extensive knowledge of Python, SQL, and Azure tools like Databricks and Microsoft Fabric, be familiar with Jupyter Notebook or R Studio, and possess:


Broad experience with data engineering and data management
Strong project management skills and experience from implementing BI solution in a larger organization
Expert knowledge in analysing, modelling, and interpreting complex data sets
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal


Your current colleagues would describe you as someone who is collaborative, confident and has a structured approach to problem-solving, and you are known for building strong relationships across your organisation. Furthermore, we are looking for a colleague who is:


Impact oriented, quality-conscious, and with good analytical skills
Well-organised and able to structure complex matters
Able to understand the link between technical solutions, data and organisational behaviour
Curiosity driven, resourceful and resilient
A team player that thrives in a collaborative working environment



What We Offer


A steep learning curve by taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realise own initiatives and implement your ideas
A development-focused workplace where you will be given opportunities to grow both personally and professionally



Working at the Novo Nordisk Foundation

We offer a committed and professional workplace in which we emphasize ensuring that our colleagues thrive, are challenged and have opportunities to develop their potential. A career at the Novo Nordisk Foundation gives you the opportunity to work: 

on important projects that benefit society; 

with key actors within research and development in Denmark;

and as part of a dedicated team that is passionate about creating value for society.

Application and Information

For further information, please contact Head of Data, Senior Impact Lead, Rasmus Vendelbo Lund Jensen on e-mail: RLJ@novo.dk

We encourage you to send your application as soon as possible and no later than 20 October 2024.

To apply, please send your CV, cover letter, grade transcript from university or similar, and other relevant documents by clicking the "Apply now" button.

About The Novo Nordisk Foundation

The Novo Nordisk Foundation dates back to 1922, and is an independent Danish foundation with corporate interests. Our vision is to contribute significantly to research and development that improves the lives of people and the sustainability of society.

In the period 2018-2022, the Novo Nordisk Foundation has awarded DKK 30.6 billion through more than 3,150 grants. Of these, 44% (DKK 13.4 billion) were awarded for physiological, endocrinological, metabolic and other medical research, 5% (DKK 1.5 billion) have been awarded for research hospital activities within diabetes and 51% (DKK 15.6 billion), were awarded for other scientific, humanitarian and social purposes, respectively. The Foundation gets its income from ownership in the Novo Group companies and more than 160 other life science companies.

In the coming years, the Foundation will further broaden its scope and increase its grants for scientific, humanitarian and social purposes. As a consequence, we are a growing organization, which means new job openings and exciting opportunities for employees to be a part of forming the future of the Foundation.

Read more about the Novo Nordisk Foundation's history, strategy and ownership structure here: Frontpage - Novo Nordisk Fonden.

Title: C/C++ Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
to Danish Growth Company developing Cyber Defence Systems




Would you like to have great influence developing company core products – and be part of a company making a huge difference for security of our society and worldwide?

Our client Arbit Cyber Defence Systems is in rapid growth, and we are now looking for a talented Software Engineer to join their R&D team. If you are a highly skilled C/C++ low-level developer and would like to work with the highest levels of security technology, this is your opportunity to make a significant impact.

Arbit Cyber Defence Systems specializes in cybersecurity with focus on network protection. They develop and produce a range of certified and accredited Cross Domain Solutions for high security networks. Their Data Diode and the Arbit TRUST Gateway solve the challenges of running high security networks (disconnected/air gapped/galvanic) as they ensure seamless transfer of data including integration with Multi Engine Virus scanning and Data Sanitization. Customers primarily are in Intelligence, Armed Forces, National Government, Police and Defence Industry across Europe, North Africa, and Asia.

The company is based in Hvidovre close to Copenhagen (and very close to the train station and highway).

About the position and responsibilities

You will be responsible for both low-level system development tasks and architecture of the Arbit TRUST Gateway. The role will involve working on high-security networks and implementing unidirectional data transfer technology.




You will work in a highly skilled team of eight software developers based entirely in Hvidovre, Denmark, and you will report directly to the CTO. Each developer works on interdependent components, and they work together sharing knowledge on weekly meetings using Jira/Kanban.




We expect you to have the following qualifications:




General software development skills and at least three years of experience with C or/and C++ programming
Knowledge of Computer Science principles and low-level computer architecture
Experience with Linux at the system admin level
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
Understanding of network security concepts and UDP network protocols
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field




Nice-to-have skills:




Knowledge of containerization technologies (e.g., Docker)
Experience with Java programming
Experience in interfacing with smart cards
Interest in advanced security technologies (e.g. Content Disarm & Reconstruction)




Fluency in English is necessary, and you understand and speak some Danish.




Due to the high level of security concerning Arbit customers as well as their own certifications, it is required that you can maintain a security clearance of level SECRET (HEMMELIGT).




The company offers

In Arbit, you will be part of an international and highly successful company. You will get a lot of influence in this key position developing their core product, and you will work with a talented and passionate R&D team. They encourage high quality focus from everyone and an open mind, while also having fun. There is freedom of opinions and a greater purpose which you will become part of.




Arbit have spacious offices in Hvidovre where you will find their highly dedicated employees, more than 20 today. They offer great benefits, such as flexible working hours, a pension scheme, health care program, fitness facilities, Arbit-days, and a yearly bonus when successful.




More about Arbit Cyber Defence Systems




This company was founded in 2006 and has over the past years had great success in their cybersecurity field becoming more and more important and critical today. Arbit is the one of very few companies in the world who has products which are accredited NATO COSMIC TOP SECRET & EU TOP SECRET.




See more on arbitcds.com.




Are your interested in joining Arbit?




Please do not hesitate to apply for the position by sending your CV and a short application. If you have questions, you are most welcome to contact Director Sara Juhl at Bloom via sj@bloom.dk.

At Bloom we are continuously evaluating applications, and we look forward to hearing from you.




If you apply for the job via 'Easy Apply', do not expect a response to your application. You will always receive a response if you apply through the job advertisement on https://bloom.dk/jobs/
