Title: Developer External Integrations
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to develop exciting software solutions for international customers and make resilient integrations with external partners? Now is the time to act!

We are looking for a developer who will help us make high-quality integrations and support our current solutions.




The role

Within the Marketplace Development department, your focus will be developing and maintaining our external auctions. Currently, we integrate with several external auction partners leading to a high volume of cars on our platform.

Our solutions are developed in Java and our main tech stack is Spring Framework, Amazon Web Services, Hibernate, Jenkins, Maven, Oracle SQL, Tomcat, and Git. The partners we integrate with have other technologies we sometimes need to understand to make resilient integrations.

As a developer with us, you will work in a smaller team dedicated to our external auctions. However, you will still experience great collaboration, knowledge sharing, and willingness to help across teams.




Key responsibilities

Your main tasks will be:

Developing systems integrating external partner auctions with the Autorola Auction platform.
Making resilient solutions and maintaining them as needed
Working with machine-to-machine communication only




Qualifications

You can have a diverse background, but to succeed in the role we imagine you possess the following qualifications:

Experience with connecting to external APIs and data mapping across systems
Experience with Java and Spring or C#
A relevant educational background in software development
Fluent in English
Experience with messaging technologies and concurrent programming is a plus




Your personality is equally important and we are looking for a person with a positive mindset. From time to time, you will act as third-level support (within normal working hours) so you must like to put on your investigative hat and help with troubleshooting. You must also be able to proactively and independently communicate with developers from other global companies if the integrations are misbehaving.




What we offer

You will join a well-functioning department that includes both new hires and highly experienced developers. We are a fast-growing and established company with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We have an open-office environment, which is characterized by an informal and easygoing communicative culture. Our headquarters are located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A 5000 Odense C.




We offer a 37-hour work week with flexible hours and the possibility of working from home a couple of days per week, providing an excellent opportunity to balance family life and leisure. We understand the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance and are committed to supporting our employees. Therefore, we ensure a manageable workload that allows you to complete tasks effectively and efficiently.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as get the chance to participate in the company’s social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and we like to end the week in our Friday bar.

For more information regarding the job, you are welcome to contact Anne Marie Lund Ohm, Software Development Manager at aml@autorola.com.




Start date

By agreement

We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.

________________________________________________________________________________

Autorola Groupis a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions for professional used car and fleet management. Autorola Group is divided into three global business units:

Autorola Marketplace: provides worldwide auction platforms for used cars. Marketplace is characterized by running a large portfolio of apps, focusing on performance and high availability.
Autorola Solutions: customized solutions to fleet owners covering the specific needs in OEM, bank, and leasing segments all over the world.
Indicata: is a global leader in providing business intelligence and market insights software, specifically designed for dealer groups, fleet owners and OEMs in the automotive industry. Our platform empowers businesses with real-time data analytics to optimize vehicle inventory management, pricing strategies, and market performance. With a presence in over 17 countries, we are driving innovation in used vehicle operations across Europe and beyond.

We work like a matrix organization, where each business unit has their own dedicated product line, designing, developing, and maintaining software solutions.

You can read much more about us at www.autorolagroup.com, www.autocom.dk, www.indicata.dk,

autorolasolutions.com, and, https://www.linkedin.com/company/autorola-software-development/

Show more
HTML:
Would you like to develop exciting software solutions for international customers and make resilient integrations with external partners? Now is the time to act!

We are looking for a developer who will help us make high-quality integrations and support our current solutions.


The role

Within the Marketplace Development department, your focus will be developing and maintaining our external auctions. Currently, we integrate with several external auction partners leading to a high volume of cars on our platform.

Our solutions are developed in Java and our main tech stack is Spring Framework, Amazon Web Services, Hibernate, Jenkins, Maven, Oracle SQL, Tomcat, and Git. The partners we integrate with have other technologies we sometimes need to understand to make resilient integrations.

As a developer with us, you will work in a smaller team dedicated to our external auctions. However, you will still experience great collaboration, knowledge sharing, and willingness to help across teams.


Key responsibilities

Your main tasks will be:

  • Developing systems integrating external partner auctions with the Autorola Auction platform.
  • Making resilient solutions and maintaining them as needed
  • Working with machine-to-machine communication only


Qualifications

You can have a diverse background, but to succeed in the role we imagine you possess the following qualifications:

  • Experience with connecting to external APIs and data mapping across systems
  • Experience with Java and Spring or C#
  • A relevant educational background in software development
  • Fluent in English
  • Experience with messaging technologies and concurrent programming is a plus


Your personality is equally important and we are looking for a person with a positive mindset. From time to time, you will act as third-level support (within normal working hours) so you must like to put on your investigative hat and help with troubleshooting. You must also be able to proactively and independently communicate with developers from other global companies if the integrations are misbehaving.

Therefore, we ensure a manageable workload that allows you to complete tasks effectively and efficiently.


You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as get the chance to participate in the company’s social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and we like to end the week in our Friday bar.

Title: Senior Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kunne du tænke dig at blive en del af et særdeles empatisk og alternativt rådgivende konsulenthus indenfor digitalisering, baseret på høj faglighed og tillid – alt sammen i øjenhøjde med vores kunder?




Sætter du pris på et godt kollegaskab, hvor vidensdeling og samhørighed er i fokus?

Trustworks vækster fordi vi i stigende grad er efterspurgte hos vores kunder. Derfor søger vi nu en passioneret Senior Udvikler, der mestrer programmering på højt niveau, og som har erfaring med komplekse systemer og integrationer. Som Senior Udvikler deltager man i kundeleverancer og arbejder i en konsulentrolle med og hos kunder hver dag indenfor de 4 fokusområder; grøn omstilling, fremtidens finansielle sektor, offentlig digitalisering samt pharma/life science.




I Trustworks er vi lige nu godt 90 ansatte, hvoraf 15 på nuværende tidspunkt, arbejder med arkitektur, integration og udvikling.

Den ideelle kandidat bidrager til udviklingen af vores kunders kritiske systemer og har særligt fokus på at skabe løsninger, der løser reelle forretningsbehov og som minimerer kompleksitet og forretningsmæssig risiko.




Vores værktøjskasse indeholder elementer som Event Modeling, CQRS, Event Sourcing, Autonomous Components, Event Driven Architecture, Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP), Domain Driven Design og lignende moderne tilgange.




Vi er baseret på tillid, empati og høj faglighed

Trustworks er et konsulenthus beliggende på Kultorvet i København i spritnye lokaler. Vi har siden 2014 ydet rådgivning og kvalitative konsulentydelser i samarbejde med vores kunder. Vores vision er at blive det mest tillidsvækkende IT-konsulenthus i markedet.




Med din rummelighed, empati og lyst til at samarbejde, bliver du en naturlig del af teamet og virksomhedens kultur. Vores tilgang til verden kan beskrives med tre ord: ambitiøst, ydmygt og empatisk.




Dine kernekompetencer og erfaringer




Du har

Erfaring med kompleks systemudvikling, integrationer og datakvalitet.
Forståelse for valget mellem monolitisk arkitektur, Microservices eller Serverless løsninger, samt begreber som CQRS, Event Sourcing og Eventual Consistency.
Erfaring med eller interesse i Domain Driven Design.
En stærk interesse for at sætte sig ind i kundens forretning og forretningsprocesser, suppleret med evnen til at udvikle skræddersyede løsninger, der præcist adresserer disse behov, samtidig med at de holder systemets kompleksitet på et minimum.
Fokus på at undgå accidental complexity og over-engineering.




Tekniske Kvalifikationer

Erfaring med mindst et af følgende programmeringssprog og deres relaterede teknologier:

Java eller Kotlin
.NET, specifikt C# eller F#
NodeJS med TypeScript eller JavaScript
Erfaring med Docker og gerne erfaring med Kubernetes




Personlige Egenskaber

En stærk analytisk tilgang og evnen til at tænke kritisk.
Står ubesværet overfor kundernes tekniske ledelse og teams.
Glimrende kommunikationsevner og evnen til at arbejde tværfagligt.
Selvmotiveret og drevet af at skabe kvalitetsløsninger.




Faglig sparring og eget kompetencebudget

Du skal synes at det er sjovt at arbejde et sted, som ikke har svar på alt, hvor vi ikke er perfekte, men hvor hjerte, vilje og vej er vores vigtigste aktiv.

For at lykkedes i Trustworks skal du udvise rummelighed, empati og lyst til at samarbejde med kolleger, som ikke nødvendigvis ligner dig selv. Vi er en samling af mange forskellige mennesker med forskellige baggrunde og kompetencer, og vi interesserer os for hinanden og glæder os til at byde dig velkommen i flokken.

Vi dyrker arbejdsmiljø, viden, holdånd og udvikling aktivt. Det er derfor vigtigt, at du er nysgerrig på ny viden og har lyst til at fortsætte din egen udvikling, hvor du gerne bidrager til, at tingene forbedrer sig løbende til din egen, Trustworks og kundernes fordel. Du udvikler dig både gennem kundeopgaver, faglig sparring fra dine kolleger, gennem efteruddannelse og certificeringer, som du selv vælger ud fra dit personlige kompetencebudget.




En fleksibel arbejdsplads hvor alle løfter i flok

Som ’Trustworker’ bliver du en del af en rummelig og fleksibel kultur med højt til loftet og fokus på at levere værdi hos vores kunder. Vores kunder engagerer sig med én eller flere Trustworkere, men får i praksis adgang til alle Trustworkeres kompetencer. Det er sådan, vi mener, at vi kan gøre noget ekstra for vores kunder, når vi løser projekter; og sådan vi gør en forskel. Vi tror nemlig fuldt ud på, at vi alle kan gøre en forskel som konsulenter, uanset erfaringsniveau. Derfor er vores bonusordning også solidarisk.




Vi glæder os til, du bliver en del af os

Send dit CV til på career@trustworks.dk og skriv kort lidt om din motivation for at søge. Du er også velkommen til at ringe til Team Lead Rasmus Rask Andersen på 25267711, hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet eller om Trustworks som arbejdsplads.

Show more

Title: Mobile App Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to contribute to the daily work tools of several hundred thousands of active users worldwide?

Your new role

Our mobile applications are a core part of our SaaS product, which aims to digitalize the construction industry. These mobile applications are developed with many different user groups in mind, and includes functionalities such as Augmented Reality, 360 photos and videos, viewing 2D drawings and are particularly known for the performant handling of largest 3D models on the market and much more.

As Mobile App Developer, you would work as part of a team of highly skilled developers, on the development of new features and improvements for these applications, creating highly user-friendly and user-centric cross-platform apps for both Android and iOS. The apps are written in .NET MAUI.

Additionally, we utilize:


C#
.NET MAUI
SQLite
Realm
MSSQL
ASP.NET
Git
Fastlane
Visual Studio


The development is characterized by agile methodologies with approximately six annual releases. Between releases we prefer to focus on the development of new features in iterations, thus ensuring we continuously and quickly offer our customers and users an improved product.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have experience with mobile development from a professional environment. Experience with cross-platform development such as Xamarin, .NET MAUI, Flutter and similar is a plus but not a requirement.
Are proactive, solution-oriented and able to work both independently and as part of a team


What To Expect As a Daluxian

Our flat organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate and young individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. Everyday life is characterized by sparring between colleagues, room to be yourself, with monthly social events and various clubs.

As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 140 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Embedded Software Engineer
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Embedded Software Engineer




Develco Products are expanding and seeking a skilled embedded software engineer who is passionate about IoT solutions and developing IoT devices for the care, energy, and security markets to join their team.

Join a pioneering company, where your role as an Embedded Software Engineer in the Firmware team will make a significant impact on their success in the high-tech IoT solutions space within healthcare, energy management, and security. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in developing new solutions and products, focusing on customer experience, sensor data, radio communication, low power microcontrollers, and optimal RF performance.




Join their Engineering team

The Firmware development team participates in the product development from the project concept phase through the feasibility phase and development, test, and approval phases until the first product leaves the production line.




About the position

As an Engineer in the Firmware development team, you will collaborate closely with team members and other teams to provide timely solutions and deliveries in projects. You work together in an agile setting, where you and your team set the structure for sharing the tasks. You and your team are responsible for technologies ranging from embedded ARM Cortex-M processors to Build-root-based Cortex-A processors.

As an Embedded Software Engineer, you'll have the unique opportunity to work on a diverse range of projects, contributing to the ongoing success of our IoT solutions. You'll develop a wide array of solutions, focusing on adding new functionalities to our different embedded platforms and introducing new technologies to our evolving product portfolio. This role offers a dynamic and challenging environment where you and your team will execute and document design decisions and solutions.




Responsibilities:

Design and development of different embedded SW for our IoT platforms.
Technical specification and technical follow-up with the other teams to identify and break down work tasks.
Document designdecisions and solutions.
Test and validation of new software and products to the full value chain.




About you

Develco Products is looking for a talented embedded software engineer with the following qualifications:

Experience in software development in C/C++ for embedded systems
Worked with Embedded development, Phyton and shell scripting.
Experience with IoT technologies, such as Zigbee, Bluetooth/BLE, WiFi, LTE and Wireless M-Bus, is an advantage.
Experience designing embedded time-critical systems.
Takes end-to-end ownership of design and solutions.
Detail-oriented and committed to maintaining high-quality standards.




The work environment

At Develco Products, you'll enjoy working in a vibrant R&D-focused environment, surrounded by a highly skilled workforce. Our modern office space includes a gourmet canteen, and they prioritize a healthy work-life balance with flexible working hours. Our active staff association organizes team-building activities, and they provide attractive pension and healthcare arrangements to prioritize your well-being.




Application

The recruitment process is handled by mpeople A/S for Develco Products.

If you can see yourself in this position, please do not hesitate to apply!

Please submit your resume and a cover letter via the link above.




About Develco Products

Develco Products is a B2B company providing white label products within the fields of healthcare, energy management, security, and insurtech. They develop, produce, and market high-volume customized products for companies supplying end-users with Internet of Things solutions.

Develco Products helps their customers unleash their creativity by building customized applications, while they handle the intricate details of products and connectivity. Through rapid growth, they have solidified their position as wireless communication experts, offering an extensive range of products such as sensors, meter interfaces, smart plugs, and advanced, flexible gateways.

Show more

The recruitment process is handled by mpeople A/S for Develco Products.

If you can see yourself in this position, please do not hesitate to apply!

Please submit your resume and a cover letter via the link above.


About Develco Products

Develco Products is a B2B company providing white label products within the fields of healthcare, energy management, security, and insurtech. They develop, produce, and market high-volume customized products for companies supplying end-users with Internet of Things solutions.

Develco Products helps their customers unleash their creativity by building customized applications, while they handle the intricate details of products and connectivity. Through rapid growth, they have solidified their position as wireless communication experts, offering an extensive range of products such as sensors, meter interfaces, smart plugs, and advanced, flexible gateways.

Title: Front-Office Full Stack Developer
Description:
We are Centrica! We’re so much more than an energy company. We’re a family of brands revolutionising a cleaner, greener future. Working here is #MoreThanACareer - we’re powered by purpose. Together we can make an impact that will truly change tomorrow. Whether you’re developing cutting-edge green tech, helping customers on the front line or simplifying operations behind the scenes.

Your work here isn’t just a job – it’s a mission. We all play a vital role in energising a greener, fairer future.

Energy movers by nature!

Would you like a self-empowered workday, where the fruits of your labour are put to immediate use? A place where you can help solve Europe’s energy challenges through software development, while making your mark within a leading energy trading company?

We are looking for a new Developer with a natural drive and the willingness and ability to take the lead on complex design and software initiatives for our Trading Analytics Development Team. Is that you?

The role

You will be working with forefront technologies such as AWS and CI/CD deployments on a microservice architecture – it’s critical that the technologies we use are leading-edge, aligning with our vision to create the best trading support tools. This is a central focus point for our Development Department, and we prioritize you becoming an integral part of that vision. We are not just talking about new technologies, we are seizing the opportunities – investing both time and money into your education, understanding the necessity of investment to achieve improvement.

The position is based in either our Copenhagen or Aalborg office. For this role, we are hiring based on your skills as well as desires. Currently, our primary focus is to enable a stable growth of our analytics platform and its capabilities. How often do you get the chance to work in a self-empowered team, and actively take part in forming how we work?

The ideal candidate

Most important is that you have a passion for delivering high quality software solutions. It is a simple as that. Furthermore, the ideal candidate:


Has around 3-5 years of relevant experience with software development,
Ideally holds a relevant education within computer science or a related field,
Likes close collaboration with internal customers on all phases of a products life cycle,
Is a team player that wants the team to succeed together,
Strives to learn and understand the energy trading business domain,
Likes to explore new technologies and continuously expands skill set.


To name some of the technologies in our technology stack:


Python backend, React (TypeScript) frontend, a little exposure to C# .NET,
AWS (ECS, Lambda, RDS, CloudWatch, etc.), Azure DevOps (CI/CD),
Kafka, SQL (Postgres), API interfaces (REST, GraphQL).


All supporting our Cloud first agenda. It would be an advantage if you are familiar with some of the items in our technology stack.

What’s it like working at Centrica Energy?

As a Developer you’ll be part of a skilled Kanban team in our Development Department, consisting of more than 70 colleagues. You can look forward to a diverse role, where you’ll be working with various technologies and development tasks, with a consistent focus on software development in React, Python, automated tests and deployments to enable continuous delivery. We embrace change. Requirements may change daily, and we deliver several new versions of our software every day. Thanks to a micro-service architecture, continuous delivery and close cooperation with our in-house customers, we get immediate feedback which is as rewarding as it is challenging.

We recognize that a career in Software Development requires continuous learning – that’s why we engage our employees in Guilds driving both technical innovation, process improvements and social activities. Our Skills Guilds drive learning activities such as Hackathons, Study Groups and Brown Bag Sessions, and our Social and Work Life Guild drive frequent social events such as department events, Friday Bars etc. Additionality we have an active Staff Association that arranges all sorts of activities – ranging from Foosball tournaments to LAN parties.

Centrica Energy is the trading and asset management arm of Centrica plc. We are a leading European energy trader with +13 GW of renewable power under management and over 15 years of experience innovating the European PPA market. We trade LNG, gas, power and energy attributes - and connect independent producers, suppliers and corporate off-takers in the wholesale energy markets.

We look forward to hearing from you!

We’re reviewing applications and conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so don’t miss your chance to apply today.

Please don’t hesitate to contact Leon Schwenk-Nebbe, Head of Analytics Development Denmark, on leon.nebbe@centrica.com if you have any questions or would like to know more about the position.

PLEASE APPLY ONLINE by hitting the 'Apply' button.

Applications will ONLY be accepted via the ‘Apply’ button.

This role is being handled by the Centrica recruitment team and NO agency contact is required.

Title: Software Test Engineer
Description:
Software test engineer with focus on test automation for multi domain systems, Søborg




Terma is facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. In space, we are engaged in reaching new frontiers and enabling people on our planet to deal with new and upcoming challenges.

Therefore, we are currently looking for a Software test engineer to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Key Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will cover a wide range of testing activities to ensure the quality and reliability of our software solutions with primary focus on test automation framework:

Design, develop and maintain automated tests to increase testing efficiency and coverage
Integration of automated tests with the CI-CD pipeline
Manual Testing: Perform hands-on manual testing to identify defects, verify fixes, and ensure that the software meets the required standards and specifications.
Contributing to a Test Community of Practice: Engage with other test enthusiasts to share knowledge, best practices, and continuously improve testing methodologies and processes.
Continuously Improving Ways of Working: Participate in process improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of testing activities.

You have a real passion for testing and test automation. Enthusiasm for quality in software development and the desire to impact software that makes the world a safer place while securing people through advanced technology is crucial.

Qualifications

We are looking for a candidate with solid experience in test automation and testing activities in software development, with an understanding of what to test, where, and when, and how tools can support this. Documented knowledge of testing with agile development methods (Scrum) as well as more project-oriented processes is essential, along with an understanding of the values created by Continuous Integration and Delivery. Most importantly, the ideal candidate will have a real passion for testing.

Additionally, we expect you to be passionate about your work, actively follow through on tasks, and thrive in a complex and highly specialized environment. You should be capable of devising ways to improve processes, supporting the team, and taking pride in communicating and acting proactively with teammates and stakeholders. Strong organizational skills and excellent articulation in writing and speaking, at a minimum in English, preferably also in Danish, are essential.

Preferred qualifications include:

Test automation frameworks and tools
Extensive experience with Python
Solid experience with testing activities in software development.
Understanding of agile development methods (Scrum) and project-oriented processes.
Certification in software testing principles (ISTQB, TMAP, or similar).
Ability to work in a complex, specialized environment.
Strong communication skills in English and preferably Danish.
Ability to improve processes and support team efforts proactively.







Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

Convenient Locations: You can work from any of our locations in Lystrup, Søborg or Grenaa, if your tasks permit










We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.




We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.




Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: mnor@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.




Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation




Show more

Title: Senior Software Architect
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dawn Health is a leading Digital Health product company that empowers Life Science companies to create elegantly designed digital solutions quickly and in compliance with the highest quality and reliability standards. Software Engineering is the cornerstone of our work. We are looking for a Software Architect to join our team in Copenhagen.




The Opportunity

You will be working in the interface between the product, software engineering, project management and systems engineering to build world class software and documentation.




You will play a key role in driving technical decisions that ensure robust and scalable products and documentation. You have a deep understanding of software; you are able to engage with developers and you can utilize this knowledge to support sound technical decisions. You are able to drive consensus in a complex landscape of both internal and external stakeholders. As part of a development team, you will have the responsibility to find pragmatic solutions to challenges involving several stakeholders internally, as well as with customers.

You will play a key role in establishing and improving how Dawn Health works with architecture and the core product infrastructure.




We would like you to:

Drive architectural decisions in SaMD (Software as Medical Device) and unregulated digital health projects
Create SW architecture according to relevant medical device standards
Drive external integration activities
Act as technical interface towards customer counterparts and ensure that customer needs are met
Ensure scalable and extendable architecture
Support the development and system engineering teams in applying state of the art development methods
Support requirements elicitation, safety and cyber security risk management and detailed design documentation work




We need you to:

You have a structured approach and understand the importance of high-quality documentation
You are self-managed and can manage your own deliverables as well as those of other project members
You are passionate about building great products that have a real impact on people's lives
You have strong analytical abilities and can break down complex problems
You have strong communication skills and can work well in a team
You have a continuous improvement mindset and enjoy setting up processes that will improve how we work
You enjoy having ownership of the product from design input, through design documentation to verification




Your qualifications and experiences:

5 years of experience in working hands on with software architecture or leading SW development
Experience in working in a regulated environment
Experience in working in an interdisciplinary team
Experience in working as a consultant or directly with customers preferred
Experience with software as medical device or a similar regulated environment preferred
Experience with relevant standards including ISO 13485, IEC 62304, ISO 14971, ISO 82304 preferred
Knowledge of data regulations and cyber security




The Team:

You will be joining the platform team at Dawn Health. Collaboration and open dialogue are the bedrock of our success. We function at the crossroads of multiple projects, ensuring that each initiative is anchored in robust architecture and system design. Our regular meetings serve as an opportunity to discuss prevailing challenges, brainstorm innovative solutions, and share knowledge. This rhythm keeps us aligned, informed, and connected, ensuring that each member is supported, and every perspective is considered.




Our approach is both systematic and adaptive, combining structured methodologies with the agility to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital health. The team thrives on mutual respect, continuous learning, and a shared commitment to excellence. As we foster an environment of collective growth, we remain united in our goal: engineering world-class software solutions that resonate with Dawn Health's mission.




Joining us means becoming part of a forward-thinking community, where every architect and engineer contributes to shaping the future of digital health.




We offer:

Meaningful projects and own products that need your valued input and leadership and will make a real impact on patient lives.
Autonomy, self-leadership, and confidence in you and your abilities.
A place to grow your career in one of the leading digital health scale-ups.
A portfolio of the world’s leading pharma clients.
A chance to work alongside innovative colleagues that are great at what they do and are happy to share knowledge.
An open, informal, and friendly atmosphere, which we are proud of and nourish.
The possibility to leave your mark on digital health.




About Dawn Health:

Dawn Health is a digital health company specializing in developing Software as Medical Device (SaMD) and other regulated healthcare solutions. We deliver both strategic consulting and development of innovative digital therapies targeting patients on a global scale. Working at Dawn Health is more than just a job. We are not just looking for new employees. We are looking for deeply passionate souls, gifted minds, innovators, team players, entrepreneurs and people who believe they can change the world. We love to build things, change the status quo, and drive a new digital health agenda that will impact 1 million patients by 2030.




Our passion not only includes the urge to make a difference, and “Code to Save Lives”, we’re also very focused on our people. There is a great social culture at Dawn Health, and throughout the company you will find warm, helpful, and friendly colleagues. When we hire, we do not just look for professional skills and talent, we look for people who will thrive in our environment and who will make a good addition to the team and contribute to the culture.




Our DNA:

We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions of patients. At Dawn Health, engineers not only revolutionize the healthcare industry, but they also routinely work on innovation projects with the potential to become large-scale applications and entirely new digital health platforms.

Title: Boomi Developer
Description:
Do you want EPICO to be your partner and agent?

To us, you are not just a number in a CV database, but a carefully chosen partner. Our most important task is to ensure the right match between you and our customers. That is why, we help you make sure that your CV is razor sharp, as well as guide and help you through our customers’ recruitment processes.

At EPICO, we have a vision to become the preferred and most trusted IT partner globally, ensuring today’s and tomorrow’s developments within IT for our partners. We will only achieve this if we can provide the right consultant, meaning; your skills, as well as your development and job satisfaction, are important to us. At EPICO, you’ll be part of a network of more than 500 consultants on assignment and be part of one of Denmark’s fastest growing IT consultancies with more than 10 years of experience in the industry.




Right now EPICO is searching for an experienced Boomi Developer to join our clients team as a consultant on a permanent basis.




About the Company:

Our client, in the airlines industry, supported by Epico, is looking for a skilled integration boomi developer with a passion for solving complex technical problems and a desire to work in an innovative environment.




About the Role:

Are you an experienced Boomi Developer ready to take on new challenges with a forward-thinking company? If you thrive in a role that offers autonomy, technical mentorship, and the opportunity to contribute to a green agenda, this is the perfect opportunity for you!




Responsibilities:

Integration Development: Design and develop robust integration solutions using Boomi and Azure cloud platforms.
DevOps Practices: Work with automation, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud integration.
Web Services: Implement and manage REST, SOAP, and WSDL technologies, utilizing test tools to ensure flawless integrations.
Programming & Data Management: Bring your knowledge of Python, .NET, or similar technologies along with SQL expertise to ensure data consistency and system integration.
API Development: Manage complex API projects and development tasks.




Qualifications:

Minimum 2 years as a Boomi Developer with a solid understanding of integration architecture.




Required Skills:

Strong proficiency in Boomi (integration platform) and Azure (cloud platform).
Proven experience in DevOps methodologies including automation and cloud integration.
Familiarity with Python, .NET, and SQL. Additional experience with REST and SOAP is essential.
Logical and problem-solving mindset with a focus on robustness and monitoring.




Bonus Skills:

Experience with Agile tools, such as Azure DevOps.
Knowledge of Azure Integration Services, particularly Service Bus.
Experience with Java or Groovy.
Ability to quickly learn new tools, languages, and systems through training.







Interested in hearing more? Dont hesitate to apply or reach out to Mads Lund Sakota-Olsen at mol @epico.dk and he will get back to you asap.




We look forward to working with you!

ABOUT EPICO-IT

EPICO-IT is an IT consultancy with a wide range of IT resources. EPICO is one of the largest IT consultancies in Denmark and with more than 10 years of experience as a consultancy, we have built an unique knowledge base and broad network. The organization was founded in 2009 and employs more than 500 IT consultants in the Nordics and parts of Europe. EPICO received the Danish Børsen Gazelle prize in both 2015 and 2016 and has one of the largest Resource Management departments in Denmark. EPICO group consists of more than 70 employees who administrate a national and international database with more than 6.000 CV’s within all IT-areas. EPICO’s cores business consists of identifying, qualifying, and delivering freelance IT consultants to organizations. In addition to EPICO’s core business, EPICO has specialized business units: Business intelligence, Data Warehouse, Cloud and Analytics (DCA), Newly graduated and young IT consultants (EPICO NextGen), nearshore IT resources (Poland), and recruitment of IT specialists for permanent employment (EPICO Search). In EPICO we are experts in finding the experts and EPICO’s core values are based on the personal connection, trust, openness, and expertise, both for our clients and consultants.




It is EPICO’s most important task to ensure the right match between IT consultant and organization.

At EPICO-IT A/S, we strive for a healthy and diverse work environment. We are committed to providing equal opportunities, and we do not discriminate on the basis of age, gender identity, race, national or social origin, property, economic or social status, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, mental or physical ability, political beliefs, and other opinions or orientations or any other status protected under local anti-discrimination legislation. We accept the differences of every individual to better foster an environment that enables the full potential of all employees, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply for the position.

Read more about EPICO-IT A/S: www.epico.dk

HTML:
Do you want EPICO to be your partner and agent?

To us, you are not just a number in a CV database, but a carefully chosen partner. Our most important task is to ensure the right match between you and our customers. That is why, we help you make sure that your CV is razor sharp, as well as guide and help you through our customers’ recruitment processes.

At EPICO, we have a vision to become the preferred and most trusted IT partner globally, ensuring today’s and tomorrow’s developments within IT for our partners. We will only achieve this if we can provide the right consultant, meaning; your skills, as well as your development and job satisfaction, are important to us. At EPICO, you’ll be part of a network of more than 500 consultants on assignment and be part of one of Denmark’s fastest growing IT consultancies with more than 10 years of experience in the industry.


Right now EPICO is searching for an experienced Boomi Developer to join our clients team as a consultant on a permanent basis.


About the Company:

Our client, in the airlines industry, supported by Epico, is looking for a skilled integration boomi developer with a passion for solving complex technical problems and a desire to work in an innovative environment.


About the Role:

Are you an experienced Boomi Developer ready to take on new challenges with a forward-thinking company? If you thrive in a role that offers autonomy, technical mentorship, and the opportunity to contribute to a green agenda, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Title: Backend Developer for Colourbox & Skyfish
Description:
Location:

Berlin, Odense or Copenhagen, Denmark (Hybrid)




Start Date:

Flexible - We prioritize finding the right candidate.




Application Deadline:

Continuous review and interviews will be conducted until the position is filled.




Application Submission:

Please submit your application in PDF format to jobs@colourbox.com.




Contact Person:

Brian Groth, Chief Technology Officer

brian@colourbox.com




Over a million monthly website visitors. Hundreds of thousands of active users. International ambitions that we are turning into reality. We are Colourbox.




We lead Europe in providing visual content to every type of business. Our web platform grants access to millions of photos, videos, and vector illustrations supplied by 35,000+ professional creatives from across the globe. Half a million users rely on our help to buy content for every purpose imaginable. We offer them a frictionless solution with clear pricing on curated visual content that stays relevant.




We also support Europe’s largest organizations to store, structure, and share their content securely with Skyfish, our digital asset management application. Skyfish protects its users' files on secure servers, tags them automatically, and makes teamwork simple with time-limited private links. Additional streaming and gallery services supercharge media exposure. Organizations use Skyfish to maximize their security and their work capabilities simultaneously. We provide an easy-to-use system with constant new features and personable support.




Job Description




We seek a highly skilled Backend Engineer to join our team. You will play a key role in our organization, driving the development, maintenance, and expansion of our suite of products. 




You will:




Work collaboratively with the Product Development Team to create value for our customers.
Architect and develop new features while enhancing and refactoring existing ones.
Embrace iterative methodologies, both in our development process and how your write your code. 
Have strong backend skills and knowledge with a readiness to contribute to frontend tasks when required.
You will undertake tasks such as developing JSON APIs for customers and apps, aggregating data, and establishing integrations with external services.
Have a focus on ensuring quality and security standards.
Have experience with ElasticSearch and Cloud technologies; AWS is highly desirable.
Actively participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to fellow developers.
Proactively monitor and optimize the performance of our online applications and systems.
Stay informed about emerging technologies, tools, and industry trends to suggest and implement practical enhancements as needed.




Our API is written in PHP 8 and we run continuous integration via AWS. We break some parts of our product into smaller services; these are most often written in Python 3 or TypeScript




 Experience and competence we are looking for:




Object-oriented programming
Databases (SQL)
Problem-solving and troubleshooting
Collaboration and teamwork
Independently-managed, proactive work
Communicating in English with your colleagues




We offer




Working on products that already create value for our customers
A responsive working environment with a focus on personal development and learning
A talented, committed, and international team
An attractive salary, with benefits
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely




Interested?




To apply, please send your application and CV to jobs@colourbox.com. Our review and interview process is ongoing.




For any queries, feel free to reach out to Brian Groth, Chief Technology Officer, at +45 30 72 40 10 or via email at brian@colourbox.com.




–

All inquiries are handled with confidentiality.

Title: Java developer 9 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Overview:

Belmont Lavan Ltd is a premier provider of IT solutions, renowned for its innovative approach to software development and technology services. We are committed to delivering exceptional results for our clients and fostering a collaborative work environment.

Job Description:

We are seeking a talented Java Developer for a 9-month contract to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and maintaining Java applications while ensuring high-quality standards are met throughout the software development lifecycle. You will collaborate with various teams to deliver effective software solutions tailored to the needs of our clients.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and maintain Java-based applications
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
Participate in the full software development process, from requirements gathering to deployment
Debug and troubleshoot issues as they arise
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth project execution

Requirements:


Minimum of 3 years of experience in Java development
Strong understanding of Java programming concepts and best practices
Experience with web application frameworks (e.g., Spring, Hibernate)
Familiarity with database systems such as MySQL or Oracle
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment



Required Skills

Java development

Orca

Python Development

Java

English

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot’s growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! That’s where Analytics comes in - you’ll enable us measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. We’ve built a innovative analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Data Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate with Trusties in our Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams and spend your time digging through our data to provide them with data-driven insights, as well as analytics and dashboards/reporting. You’re keen to ensure them use data to answer their toughest questions, and you can proactively identify areas that need a little data support. You’ll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our data warehouse at your fingertips, working with analytical tools including BigQuery and Looker.

Commercial/Marketing

As a B2B company, understanding our customers’ journey from prospect to paid customer is key. In this role, you get to join a growing team of data analysts and work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Operations teams. The team is responsible for all types of analyses to support our marketing and commercial efforts and strategy, from understanding which marketing campaigns work well, to mapping our customers’ journey through data and analysing the impact of our pricing initiatives.

Trust

A huge part of what we do at Trustpilot is Trust (it’s in the name!). We need to ensure that the content on our platform is real content from real people. That means eliminating scam and spam, and identifying fraudulent behaviour. We have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust. You’ll be tightly aligned to their goals, supporting teams such as Content Integrity to discover fraudulent activity, andhelping data scientists assess their spam models.

What You’ll Be Doing


Delivering proficient analytics and insights to different parts of the business, through both workstream-focused initiatives and ad-hoc inquiries
Picking the right solution for the problem you’ve got, from your arsenal of analytical tools and methods
Working closely with the Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams to understand their data and their goals to deliver awesome solutions
Presenting and promoting your work to the wider business, to enable data-inform choices


Who You Are


Good knowledge of key analytical and statistical methodologies, such as model-based analyses (regression, clustering etc.), cohort analysis and A/B testing. as well as reporting best practices, leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Experience in stakeholder and project management, with the knowledge to deliver results back to the business
Proficiency in R or Python, and awesome SQL skills
Familiarity with Airflow, DBT or similar tools used for building data pipelines
Advanced written and verbal communication skills


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.
